Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Psi Blade]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand} (the hand is Invisible)

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplNondetecti]{Nondetection} (self only)

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Nondetection.name: Nondetection
Nondetection.description: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from Divination spells. The target can be a willing creature, or it can be a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. The target can’t be targeted by any Divination spell or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

fL0RMoDWLbbtqrNK.name: Misty Step
fL0RMoDWLbbtqrNK.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplElementali], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMessage000]

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLightningB]

The aarakocra casts Feather Fall in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Elementalism.name: Elementalism
Elementalism.description:
You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range.

Beckon Air. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot Cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren’t affected.

Beckon Earth. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

Beckon Fire. You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and colored, scented smoke in a 5-foot Cube. You choose the color and scent, and the embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke’s scent lingers for 1 minute.

Beckon Water. You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens creatures and objects in a 5-foot Cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a surface, and the water evaporates in 1 minute.

Sculpt Element. You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1-foot Cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature) for 1 hour.

Beckon Element.name: Beckon Element
Beckon Element.chatFlavor: Fire and water beckoning lasts for 1 minute

Gust of Wind.name: Gust of Wind
Gust of Wind.description:
A Line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the duration. Each creature in the Line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the Line. A creature that ends its turn in the Line must make the same save.

Any creature in the Line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can change the direction in which the Line blasts from you.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Message.name: Message
Message.description:
You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFeatherFal] in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as @UUID[.mmSpellcasting00].

2Zi6nV1saGPcm4KO.name: Feather Fall
2Zi6nV1saGPcm4KO.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature’s rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmWindStaff00000]] attacks, and it can use [[/item .mmSpellcasting00]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmTentacleLash00]] attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of [[/item .mmMindRot0000000]].

Tentacle Lash.name: Tentacle Lash
Tentacle Lash.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.acr.passive]]) from one of two tentacles, and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Mind Rot.name: Mind Rot
Mind Rot.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=DvEIJK7HFwBWNpkq]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=DvEIJK7HFwBWNpkq]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=DvEIJK7HFwBWNpkq]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=DvEIJK7HFwBWNpkq]] damage only.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

ACbxovsCKcunHdN8.name: Counterspell
ACbxovsCKcunHdN8.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn’t expended.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Eldritch Restoration.name: Eldritch Restoration
Eldritch Restoration.description: If destroyed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a new body in [[/r 5d10]] days, reviving with all its Hit Points in the Far Realm or another location chosen by the DM.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Mucus Cloud.name: Mucus Cloud
Mucus Cloud.description:
While underwater, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is surrounded by mucus.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=clFFG8uDBSFzxIo8]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=clFFG8uDBSFzxIo8]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=clFFG8uDBSFzxIo8]] Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] at the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s turn.

Failure: The target is cursed. Until the curse ends, the target’s skin becomes slimy, the target can breathe air and water, and it can’t regain Hit Points unless it is underwater.

While the cursed creature is outside a body of water, the creature takes [[/damage average activity=JrxCVyCOsBAMVZS7]] damage at the end of every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to its skin before those minutes have passed.

Damage: Outside Water.name: Damage: Outside Water
Damage: Outside Water.chatFlavor: Damage: Every 10 min. unless skin is wet.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: While the cursed creature is outside a body of water, the creature takes [[/damage 1d12 Acid average]] damage at the end of every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to its skin before those minutes have passed.

Probing Telepathy.name: Probing Telepathy
Probing Telepathy.description: If a creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see communicates telepathically with the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] learns the creature’s greatest desires.

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of four tentacles.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description:
Escape Tests (see origin item for DC)

[[/check skill=ath ability=str]]

[[/check skill=acr ability=dex]]

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmTentacle000000]] attacks and uses either [[/item .7gP0oX3L1RKRaBGH]] or [[/item .yiiKNaJ2svcUWqLi]] if available.

Dominate Mind.name: Dominate Mind
Dominate Mind.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=zdXAMnjaOcsVmLZP]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=zdXAMnjaOcsVmLZP]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=zdXAMnjaOcsVmLZP]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies or is on a different plane of existence from the target. While Charmed, the target acts as an ally to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and is under its control while within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=zdXAMnjaOcsVmLZP]] feet of it. In addition, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

The target repeats the save whenever it takes damage as well as after every 24 hours it spends at least 1 mile away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], ending the effect on itself on a success.

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition. While Charmed, the target acts as an ally to the dominator and is under its control while within 60 feet of it. In addition, the two can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Consume Memories.name: Consume Memories
Consume Memories.description:
Intelligence Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=uI3HDQ1grN123Or3]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=uI3HDQ1grN123Or3]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=uI3HDQ1grN123Or3]] feet. [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=uI3HDQ1grN123Or3]] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=uI3HDQ1grN123Or3]] damage.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains the target’s memories if the target is a Humanoid and is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this action.

Lash.name: Lash
Lash.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one Tentacle attack.

Psychic Drain.name: Psychic Drain
Psychic Drain.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has at least one creature Charmed or Grappled, it uses [[/item .7gP0oX3L1RKRaBGH]] and regains [[/healing average]].

Chilling Gaze.name: Chilling Gaze
Chilling Gaze.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=EREXmcv7YU7T9pj6]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=EREXmcv7YU7T9pj6]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn unless the target has Immunity to Cold damage.

Success: The target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of the user's next turn unless the target has Immunity to Cold damage.

Cold Breath.name: Cold Breath

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8P7hmd3Nron4RAIv]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8P7hmd3Nron4RAIv]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=8P7hmd3Nron4RAIv]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +9 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFear000000]{Fear}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMelfsAcidA]{Melf's Acid Arrow} (level 3 version)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplVitriolicS]{Vitriolic Sphere}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the &Reference[frightened apply=false] condition for the duration.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: A &Reference[frightened apply=false] creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Melf's Acid Arrow.name: Melf's Acid Arrow
Melf's Acid Arrow.description:
A shimmering green arrow streaks toward a target within range and bursts in a spray of acid. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d4 Acid damage and 2d4 Acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a miss, the arrow splashes the target with acid for half as much of the initial damage only.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage (both initial and later) increases by 1d4 for each spell slot level above 2.

Lingering Acid.name: Lingering Acid
Lingering Acid.description: On a hit, the target takes 4d4 Acid damage and [[/damage 2d4 type=acid]] (plus 1d4 per spell slot level above 2) Acid damage at the end of its next turn.

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Vitriolic Sphere.name: Vitriolic Sphere
Vitriolic Sphere.description:
You point at a location within range, and a glowing, 1-foot-diameter ball of acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius Sphere. Each creature in that area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d4 Acid damage and another [[/damage 5d4 type=acid]] damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage only.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The initial damage increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 4.

Lingering Acid.name: Lingering Acid
Lingering Acid.description: The creature takes [[/damage 5d4 type=acid]] damage at the end of its next turn

Cloud of Insects.name: Cloud of Insects
Cloud of Insects.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=0OkFhjOM80ipoNKy]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=0OkFhjOM80ipoNKy]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has Disadvantage on saving throws to maintain &Reference[Concentration} until the end of its next turn.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Concentration Disadvantage.name: Concentration Disadvantage
Concentration Disadvantage.description: The target has Disadvantage on saving throws to maintain Concentration until the end of its next turn

Frightful Presence.name: Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFear000000]{Fear}, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]]). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Adult Blue Dragon.description:
Blue Dragons

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.YmY5NC1DqZVHBNX2 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShatter000]{Shatter}.

Lightning Breath.name: Lightning Breath
Lightning Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]]-foot-wide [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShatter000]{Shatter}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSending000]{Sending}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description:
A loud noise erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered there makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has Disadvantage on the save.

A nonmagical object that isn’t being worn or carried also takes the damage if it’s in the spell’s area.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn’t know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target’s …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

Sending.name: Sending
Sending.description:
You send a short message of 25 words or fewer to a creature you have met or a creature described to you by someone who has met it. The target hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables targets to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn’t arrive. You know if the delivery fails.

Upon receiving your message, a creature can block your ability to reach it again with this spell for 8 hours. If you try to send another message during that time, you learn that you are blocked, and the spell fails.

Cloaked Flight.name: Cloaked Flight
Cloaked Flight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili] on itself, and it can fly up to [[lookup @range.special activity=a3NfcMs8zHADx7zs]]. The dragon can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Sonic Boom.name: Sonic Boom
Sonic Boom.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShatter000]{Shatter}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Tail Swipe.name: Tail Swipe
Tail Swipe.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Adult Brass Dragon.description:
Brass Dragons

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.3DDDv8e649NFyopV caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) [[/item Sleep Breath]] or (B) [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Sleep Breath.name: Sleep Breath
Sleep Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=6ce9oevQRWomSVSF]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=6ce9oevQRWomSVSF]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=6ce9oevQRWomSVSF]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it repeats the save.

Second Failure: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for [[lookup @duration.value activity=EZma0lCmQeTuVuAL]] minutes. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it repeats the save.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for the duration (see source item for the length of the duration). This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplControlWea]{Control Weather}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action’s skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don’t pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Control Weather.name: Control Weather
Control Weather.description:
You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, and it ends early if you go indoors.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes 1d4 × 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.

When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can change its direction.

Precipitation
StageCondition
1Clear
2Light clouds
3Overcast or ground fog
4Rain, hail, or snow
5Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard
Temperature
StageCondition
1Heat wave
2Hot
3Warm
4Cool
5Cold
6Freezing
Wind
StageCondition
1Calm
2Moderate wind
3Strong wind
4Gale
5Storm

Blazing Light.name: Blazing Light
Blazing Light.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Scorching Sands.name: Scorching Sands
Scorching Sands.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=g5fxAWhrpwohtETl]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=g5fxAWhrpwohtETl]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=g5fxAWhrpwohtETl]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Failure: 1/2 Speed.name: Failure: 1/2 Speed
Failure: 1/2 Speed.description: The target’s Speed is halved until the end of its next turn

Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) [[/item Repulsion Breath]] or (B) [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt} (level 2 version).

Lightning Breath.name: Lightning Breath
Lightning Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=LpjgVwftzGNMgTUJ]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Repulsion Breath.name: Repulsion Breath
Repulsion Breath.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=zuf9EEVj4nI1joaH]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=zuf9EEVj4nI1joaH]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=zuf9EEVj4nI1joaH]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type activity=zuf9EEVj4nI1joaH]].

Failure: The target is pushed up to 60 feet straight away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target is pushed up to 30 feet straight away from the attacking creature and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +10 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt} (level 2 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWaterBreat]{Water Breathing}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action’s skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don’t pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Water Breathing.name: Water Breathing
Water Breathing.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

Guiding Light.name: Guiding Light
Guiding Light.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt} (level 2 version).

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Thunderclap.name: Thunderclap
Thunderclap.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Lq6GexegvlEVB6Dh]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Lq6GexegvlEVB6Dh]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Lq6GexegvlEVB6Dh]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Lq6GexegvlEVB6Dh]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Deafened.name: Deafened
Deafened.description: The target is &Reference[Deafened apply=long] until the end of its next turn.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) [[/item Slowing Breath]] or (B) [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 4 version).

Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Mind Spike.name: Mind Spike
Mind Spike.description:
You drive a spike of psionic energy into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d8 Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, you also always know the target’s location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can’t become hidden from you, and if it has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Spiked.name: Spiked
Spiked.description: You always know the target’s location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can’t become hidden from you, and if it has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target’s Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target’s Hit Point maximum

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Giggling Magic.name: Giggling Magic
Giggling Magic.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Until the end of its next turn, the target rolls [[/r 1d6]] whenever it makes an ability check or attack roll and subtracts the number rolled from the D20 Test.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Giggling.name: Giggling
Giggling.description: Until the end of its next turn, the target rolls [[/r 1d6]] whenever it makes an ability check or attack and subtracts the number rolled from the D20 Test.

Mind Jolt.name: Mind Jolt
Mind Jolt.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 4 version). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Slowing Breath.name: Slowing Breath
Slowing Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.name: 1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions
1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.description: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Zone of Truth.name: Zone of Truth
Zone of Truth.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Cannot Lie.name: Cannot Lie
Cannot Lie.description:
On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Weakening Breath.name: Weakening Breath
Weakening Breath.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=EGZ4bS4HpJkfNG9s]], each creature that isn’t currently affected by this breath in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=EGZ4bS4HpJkfNG9s]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests and subtracts 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) from its damage rolls. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=EGZ4bS4HpJkfNG9s]] minute, it succeeds automatically.

Weakened.name: Weakened
Weakened.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests and subtracts 2 (1d4) from its damage rolls. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Banish.name: Banish
Banish.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=kWKwiAYgyeKBLMNJ]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=kWKwiAYgyeKBLMNJ]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and is transported to a harmless demiplane until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn, at which point it re­appears in an unoccupied space of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice within [[lookup @range.value activity=kWKwiAYgyeKBLMNJ]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again [[lookup @duration.special activity=kWKwiAYgyeKBLMNJ]].

Banished: Incapacitated.name: Banished: Incapacitated
Banished: Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and is transported to a harmless demiplane until the start of the user's next turn, at which point it re­appears in an unoccupied space of the user's choice within range of the user.

Guiding Light.name: Guiding Light
Guiding Light.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt} (level 2 version).

The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d8 Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, you also always know the target’s location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can’t become hidden from you, and if it has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

Geas.name: Geas
Geas.description:
You give a verbal command to a creature that you can see within range, ordering it to carry out some service or refrain from an action or a course of activity as you decide. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target automatically succeeds if it can’t understand your command.

While Charmed, the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell ends this spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you use a level 7 or 8 spell slot, the duration is 365 days. If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

Under Orders.name: Under Orders
Under Orders.description: While &Reference[Charmed apply=false], the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psyhic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

Mind Invasion.name: Mind Invasion
Mind Invasion.description: The dragon uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 3 version).

Commanding Presence.name: Commanding Presence
Commanding Presence.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command} (level 2 version). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn’t move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +12 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command} (level 2 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You hurl three fiery rays. You can hurl them at one target within range or at several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 Fire damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create one additional ray for each spell slot level above 2.

[[@item.level + 1]]{Total Rays}

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Fiery Rays.name: Fiery Rays
Fiery Rays.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Adult Silver Dragon.name: Adult Silver Dragon
Adult Silver Dragon.description:
Silver Dragons

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.REGxFxNrTLFswtA1 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Adult Silver Dragon

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.PhEr0qvx0sUA4mGl caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) [[/item Paralyzing Breath]] or (B) [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIceKnife00]{Ice Knife}.

Cold Breath.name: Cold Breath
Cold Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8P7hmd3Nron4RAIv]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8P7hmd3Nron4RAIv]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=8P7hmd3Nron4RAIv]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Paralyzing Breath.name: Paralyzing Breath
Paralyzing Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=r4MGqEq5U9aaseBh]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=r4MGqEq5U9aaseBh]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=r4MGqEq5U9aaseBh]]-foot Cone.

First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, when it repeats the save.

Second Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, when it repeats the save.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +11 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldMonste]{Hold Monster}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIceKnife00]{Ice Knife}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIceStorm00]{Ice Storm} (level 5 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplZoneofTrut]{Zone of Truth}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Hold Monster.name: Hold Monster
Hold Monster.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Paralyzed condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 5.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Ice Knife.name: Ice Knife
Ice Knife.description:
You create a shard of ice and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Piercing damage. Hit or miss, the shard then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 Cold damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Cold damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Ice Storm.name: Ice Storm
Ice Storm.description:
Hail falls in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the Cylinder makes a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d10 Bludgeoning damage and 4d6 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hailstones turn ground in the Cylinder into &Reference[DifficultTerrain] until the end of your next turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Bludgeoning damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 4.

Zone of Truth.name: Zone of Truth
Zone of Truth.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Cannot Lie.name: Cannot Lie
Cannot Lie.description:
On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Chill.name: Chill
Chill.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldMonste]. The dragon can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Cold Gale.name: Cold Gale
Cold Gale.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=pVs8BTVDNh54CZ0a]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=pVs8BTVDNh54CZ0a]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=pVs8BTVDNh54CZ0a]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=pVs8BTVDNh54CZ0a]] from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

save.chatFlavor: On Success: The target is pushed up to 30 feet straight away from the attacking creature

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Ice Walk.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, &Reference[Difficult Terrain] composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
