Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=IgOMjRxAt7UISkJq]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=IgOMjRxAt7UISkJq]] creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=IgOMjRxAt7UISkJq]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]).

Slowing Breath.name: Slowing Breath
Slowing Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.name: 1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions
1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.description: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

Shielded Mind.name: Shielded Mind
Shielded Mind.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s thoughts can’t be read by any means, and other creatures can communicate with it telepathically only if it allows them.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the biter's next turn.

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=IgOMjRxAt7UISkJq]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=IgOMjRxAt7UISkJq]] creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=IgOMjRxAt7UISkJq]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled and Restrained.name: Grappled and Restrained
Grappled and Restrained.description:
Escape Tests (see source item for DC)

[[/check skill=ath ability=str]]

[[/check skill=acr ability=dex]]

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateFood]{Create Food and Water}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDream00000]{Dream}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSleep00000]{Sleep}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Create Food and Water.name: Create Food and Water
Create Food and Water.description: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of fresh water on the ground or in containers within range—both useful in fending off the hazards of malnutrition and dehydration. The food is bland but nourishing and looks like a food of your choice, and the water is clean. The food spoils after 24 hours if uneaten.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description:
You target a creature you know on the same plane of existence. You or a willing creature you touch enters a trance state to act as a dream messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target’s dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the spell’s duration. The messenger can also shape the dream’s environment, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking.

If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to sleep, at which point the messenger enters its dreams.

You can make the messenger terrifying to the target. If you do so, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words, and then the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and it takes 3d6 Psychic damage when it wakes up.

Trance State.name: Trance State
Trance State.description: While in the trance, the messenger is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target’s Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target’s Hit Point maximum

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn’t know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target’s …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
Each creature of your choice in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Creatures that don’t sleep, such as elves, or that have Immunity to the Exhaustion condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

Sleeping.name: Sleeping
Sleeping.description: The target has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Hold Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hold its breath for 1 hour.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). While Grappled, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description:
If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC). While Grappled, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +4 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: Spiritual Weapon
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn’t move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Cultist Hierophant.name: Cultist Hierophant
Cultist Hierophant.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmBreastplat]{Breastplate}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol (Varies)}

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmPactBlade00000]] or [[/item .mmRadiantRay0000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplJallarzisS]{Jallarzi’s Storm of Radiance} (level 7 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMassSugges]{Mass Suggestion}

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.name: Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance
Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.description:
You unleash a storm of flashing light and raging thunder in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

When the storm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Radiant damage and 2d10 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Radiant and Thunder damage increase by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Senses Overwhelmed.name: Senses Overwhelmed
Senses Overwhelmed.description: While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

Mass Suggestion.name: Mass Suggestion
Mass Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to twelve or fewer creatures you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to any of the targets or their allies. For example, you could say, “Walk to the village down that road, and help the villagers there harvest crops until sunset.” Or you could say, “Now is not the time for violence. Drop your weapons, and dance! Stop in an hour.”

Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for a target upon completing it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The duration is longer with a spell slot of level 7 (10 days), 8 (30 days), or 9 (366 days).

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Attacks: Disadvantage.name: Attacks: Disadvantage
Attacks: Disadvantage.description: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplArcaneEye0]{Arcane Eye}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLocateObje]{Locate Object}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLegendLore]{Legend Lore}

Portent.name: Portent
Portent.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=4pPRsHy9QaQvVgqt]] it can see makes a D20 Test. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] rolls [[/r 1d20]] and chooses whether to use that roll in place of the d20 rolled for the D20 Test.

Arcane Eye.name: Arcane Eye
Arcane Eye.description:
You create an Invisible, invulnerable eye within range that hovers for the duration. You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which can see in every direction. It also has Darkvision with a range of 30 feet.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. A solid barrier blocks the eye’s movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Legend Lore.name: Legend Lore
Legend Lore.description:
Name or describe a famous person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about that famous thing, as described by the DM.

The lore might consist of important details, amusing revelations, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. The more information you already know about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is. That information is accurate but might be couched in figurative language or poetry, as determined by the DM.

If the famous thing you chose isn’t actually famous, you hear sad musical notes played on a trombone, and the spell fails.

Cyclops Sentry.name: Cyclops Sentry
Cyclops Sentry.description:
Cyclopes

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.URxt7XoMBPMOxHQ5 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Cyclops Sentry

Stone Club.name: Stone Club
Stone Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .yUKGaYJrEWWVTxZY]] or [[/item .mmRock0000000000]] in any combination.

Limited Foresight.name: Limited Foresight
Limited Foresight.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see makes an attack roll against it.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imposes Disadvantage on the roll, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains Advantage on attack rolls against the target until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Expend Use.name: Expend Use
Expend Use.condition: A creature the cyclops can see makes an attack roll against it.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t disturb the material it moves through.

Elemental Restoration.name: Elemental Restoration
Elemental Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Elemental Plane of Earth, its body dissolves into dirt, and it gains a new body in [[/r 1d4]] days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Earth.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Wishes.name: Wishes
Wishes.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a [[/r 1d100cs<31#Knows Wish on 1]]{30 percent} chance of knowing the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can understand. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the spell for the creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] suffers none of the spell’s stress. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has cast it three times, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t do so again for 365 days.

Wish.name: Wish
Wish.description:
Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter reality itself.

The basic use of this spell is to duplicate any other spell of level 8 or lower. If you use it this way, you don’t need to meet any requirements to cast that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect.

Alternatively, you can create one of the following effects of your choice:

Object Creation. You create one object of up to 25,000 GP in value that isn’t a magic item. The object can be no more than 300 feet in any dimension, and it appears in an unoccupied space that you can see on the ground.

Instant Health. You allow yourself and up to twenty creatures that you can see to regain all Hit Points, and you end all effects on them listed in the Greater Restoration spell.

Resistance. You grant up to ten creatures that you can see Resistance to one damage type that you choose. This Resistance is permanent.

Spell Immunity. You grant up to ten creatures you can see immunity to a single spell or other magical effect for 8 hours.

Sudden Learning. You replace one of your feats with another feat for which you are eligible. You lose all the benefits of the old feat and gain the benefits of the new one. You can’t replace a feat that is a prerequisite for any of your other feats or features.

Roll Redo. You undo a single recent event by forcing a reroll of any die roll made within the last round (including your last turn). Reality reshapes itself to accommodate the new result. For example, a Wish spell could undo an ally’s failed saving throw or a foe’s Critical Hit. You can force the reroll to be made with Advantage or Disadvantage, and you choose whether to use the reroll or the original roll.

Reshape Reality. You may wish for something not included in any of the other effects. To do so, state your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. The DM has great latitude in ruling what occurs in such an instance; the greater the wish, the greater the likelihood that something goes wrong. This spell might simply fail, the effect you desire might be achieved only in part, or you might suffer an unforeseen consequence as a result of how you worded the wish. For example, wishing that a villain were dead might propel you forward in time to a period when that villain is no longer alive, effectively removing you from the game. Similarly, wishing for a Legendary magic item or an Artifact might instantly transport you to the presence of the item’s current owner. If your wish is granted and its effects have consequences for a whole community, region, or world, you are likely to attract powerful foes. If your wish would affect a god, the god’s divine servants might instantly intervene to prevent it or to encourage you to craft the wish in a particular way. If your wish would undo the multiverse itself, threaten the City of Sigil, or affect the Lady of Pain in any way, you see an image of her in your mind for a moment; she shakes her head, and your wish fails.

The stress of casting Wish to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take 1d10 Necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for 2d4 days. For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a [[/r 1d3cs1]]{33 percent chance} that you are unable to cast Wish ever again if you suffer this stress.

Wish Stress.name: Wish Stress
Wish Stress.description: Each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take [[/damage 1d10 type=necrotic]] damage per level of that spell. This damage can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for [[/r 2d4]] days.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three Earthen Maul attacks or two Earth Burst attacks.

Earthen Maul.name: Earthen Maul
Earthen Maul.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Earth Burst.name: Earth Burst
Earth Burst.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Hit or Miss: Earth explodes from the target’s space, creating the following effect.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=TS5RHvq56ByTxHGi]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=TS5RHvq56ByTxHGi]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=TS5RHvq56ByTxHGi]]-foot Emanation originating from and including the target.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=TS5RHvq56ByTxHGi]] damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplStoneShape]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGaseousFor], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMoveEarth0], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPasswall00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWallofSton]

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Stone Shape.name: Stone Shape
Stone Shape.description: You touch a stone object of Medium size or smaller or a section of stone no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape you like. For example, you could shape a large rock into a weapon, statue, or coffer, or you could make a small passage through a wall that is 5 feet thick. You could also shape a stone door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn’t possible.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
A willing creature you touch shape-shifts, along with everything it’s wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends on the target if it drops to 0 Hit Points or if it takes a Magic action to end the spell on itself.

While in this form, the target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
The target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Move Earth.name: Move Earth
Move Earth.description:
Choose an area of terrain no larger than 40 feet on a side within range. You can reshape dirt, sand, or clay in the area in any manner you choose for the duration. You can raise or lower the area’s elevation, create or fill in a trench, erect or flatten a wall, or form a pillar. The extent of any such changes can’t exceed half the area’s largest dimension. For example, if you affect a 40-foot square, you can create a pillar up to 20 feet high, raise or lower the square’s elevation by up to 20 feet, dig a trench up to 20 feet deep, and so on. It takes 10 minutes for these changes to complete. Because the terrain’s transformation occurs slowly, creatures in the area can’t usually be trapped or injured by the ground’s movement.

At the end of every 10 minutes you spend concentrating on the spell, you can choose a new area of terrain to affect within range.

This spell can’t manipulate natural stone or stone construction. Rocks and structures shift to accommodate the new terrain. If the way you shape the terrain would make a structure unstable, it might collapse.

Similarly, this spell doesn’t directly affect plant growth. The moved earth carries any plants along with it.

Passwall.name: Passwall
Passwall.description:
A passage appears at a point that you can see on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface (such as a wall, ceiling, or floor) within range and lasts for the duration. You choose the opening’s dimensions: up to 5 feet wide, 8 feet tall, and 20 feet deep. The passage creates no instability in a structure surrounding it.

When the opening disappears, any creatures or objects still in the passage created by the spell are safely ejected to an unoccupied space nearest to the surface on which you cast the spell.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Wall of Stone.name: Wall of Stone
Wall of Stone.description:
A nonmagical wall of solid stone springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall is 6 inches thick and is composed of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. Alternatively, you can create 10-foot-by-20-foot panels that are only 3 inches thick.

If the wall cuts through a creature’s space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (you choose which side). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), that creature can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its Reaction to move up to its Speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall.

The wall can have any shape you desire, though it can’t occupy the same space as a creature or object. The wall doesn’t need to be vertical or rest on a firm foundation. It must, however, merge with and be solidly supported by existing stone. Thus, you can use this spell to bridge a chasm or create a ramp.

If you create a span greater than 20 feet in length, you must halve the size of each panel to create supports. You can crudely shape the wall to create battlements and the like.

The wall is an object made of stone that can be damaged and thus breached. Each panel has AC 15 and 30 Hit Points per inch of thickness, and it has Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. Reducing a panel to 0 Hit Points destroys it and might cause connected panels to collapse at the DM’s discretion.

If you maintain your Concentration on this spell for its full duration, the wall becomes permanent and can’t be dispelled. Otherwise, the wall disappears when the spell ends.

Crush.name: Crush
Crush.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attaches to the target. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] had Advantage on the attack roll, it covers the target, which has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition and is &Reference[suffocating apply=false]{suffocating} while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is attached in this way.

While attached to a target, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can attack only the target but has Advantage on its attack rolls. Its Speed becomes 0, it can’t benefit from any bonus to its Speed, and it moves with the target.

A creature can take an action to try to detach the [[lookup @name lowercase]] from itself, doing so with a successful [[/check format=long]]. On its turn, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can detach itself by using 5 feet of movement.

Blinded & Suffocating.name: Blinded & Suffocating
Blinded & Suffocating.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition and is &Reference[suffocating apply=false]{suffocating} while the attacking creature is attached to the target.

Self: Attack Adv./0 Speed.name: Self: Attack Adv./0 Speed
Self: Attack Adv./0 Speed.description: While attached to a target, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can attack only the target but has Advantage on its attack rolls. Its Speed becomes 0, it can’t benefit from any bonus to its Speed, and it moves with the target.

Darkness Aura.name: Darkness Aura
Darkness Aura.description: Magical Darkness fills a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=amat5Ii4NydseA0h]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name]]. This effect lasts while the [[lookup @name]] maintains Concentration on it, up to [[lookup @duration.value activity=amat5Ii4NydseA0h]] minutes. Darkvision can’t penetrate this area, and no light can illuminate it.

Death Cultist.name: Death Cultist
Death Cultist.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmSplintArmo]{Splint Armor}

Cultists

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VICfYukXoYkWJ1yn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Death Cultist

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.n7c1yeBdbTnjOZNX caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmDreadScythe000]]Dread Scythe or [[/item .mmDeathlyRay0000]] in any combination.

Dread Scythe.name: Dread Scythe
Dread Scythe.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of its next turn.

Healing Restriction.name: Healing Restriction
Healing Restriction.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of its next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Spirit Wail.name: Spirit Wail
Spirit Wail.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=F0T3hYR3EtUEMhvs]].

First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned, the target’s Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and it repeats the save every 24 hours that elapse, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Subsequent Failures: The Poisoned target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]).

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description:
First CON Save Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned, the target’s Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and it repeats the save every 24 hours that elapse, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Subsequent CON Save Failures: The Poisoned target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]).</p>

Death Knight.name: Death Knight
Death Knight.description:
Death Knights

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.IC2tkedmjZBt4733 caption=true cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Death Knight

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.IcPhMww7JfsVRjTT caption=true cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Marshal Undead.name: Marshal Undead
Marshal Undead.description: [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=WbzFmVAOPQ7eL6IW]] creatures of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice (excluding itself) in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=WbzFmVAOPQ7eL6IW]]-foot Emanation originating from it have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Adv: Attacks & Saves.name: Adv: Attacks & Saves
Adv: Attacks & Saves.description: The creature has Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Undead Restoration.name: Undead Restoration
Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed before it atones for its evil, it gains a new body in [[/r 1d10]] days, reviving with all its Hit Points. The new body appears in a location significant to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .g3XQNppaIISboYFh]] attacks.

Hellfire Orb.name: Hellfire Orb
Hellfire Orb.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Dread Authority.name: Dread Authority
Dread Authority.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn’t move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Fell Word.name: Fell Word
Fell Word.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=S5DW2VUgJWNBmquE]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=S5DW2VUgJWNBmquE]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=S5DW2VUgJWNBmquE]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Save.name: Save
Save.chatFlavor: The target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Lunge.name: Lunge
Lunge.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Dread Blade attack.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPhantomSte]{Phantom Steed}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDestructiv]{Destructive Wave} (Necrotic), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}

Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
Phantom Steed.description:
A Large, quasi-real, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbsumPhantomSte]{horselike creature} appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature’s appearance, and it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The steed uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobRidingHors]{Riding Horse} stat block (see appendix B), except it has a Speed of 100 feet and can travel 13 miles in an hour. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends early if the steed takes any damage.

Destructive Wave.name: Destructive Wave
Destructive Wave.description: Destructive energy ripples outward from you in a 30-foot Emanation. Each creature you choose in the Emanation makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 5d6 Thunder damage and 5d6 Radiant or Necrotic damage (your choice) and has the Prone condition. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Death Knight Aspirant.name: Death Knight Aspirant
Death Knight Aspirant.description:
Death Knight Aspirant

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Marshal Undead.name: Marshal Undead
Marshal Undead.description: [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=WbzFmVAOPQ7eL6IW]] creatures of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice (excluding itself) in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=WbzFmVAOPQ7eL6IW]]-foot Emanation originating from it have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Adv: Attacks & Saves.name: Adv: Attacks & Saves
Adv: Attacks & Saves.description: The creature has Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mOFhWkASKsQxw6ni]] attacks.

Hellfire Orb.name: Hellfire Orb
Hellfire Orb.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPhantomSte]{Phantom Steed}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDestructiv]{Destructive Wave} (Necrotic), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}

Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
Phantom Steed.description:
A Large, quasi-real, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbsumPhantomSte]{horselike creature} appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature’s appearance, and it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The steed uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobRidingHors]{Riding Horse} stat block (see appendix B), except it has a Speed of 100 feet and can travel 13 miles in an hour. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends early if the steed takes any damage.

Destructive Wave.name: Destructive Wave
Destructive Wave.description: Destructive energy ripples outward from you in a 30-foot Emanation. Each creature you choose in the Emanation makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 5d6 Thunder damage and 5d6 Radiant or Necrotic damage (your choice) and has the Prone condition. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Death Slaad.description:
Slaadi

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Chaos Blade]] attacks.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBlight0000]{Blight} (level 8 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCloudkill0]{Cloudkill} (level 6 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=EU2q25V5hIaM1ZlR]], or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, Its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Chaos Blade.name: Chaos Blade
Chaos Blade.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, &Reference[Charmed apply=false]; on a 2, &Reference[Frightened apply=false]; on a 3, &Reference[Poisoned apply=false]; or on a 4, &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Blight.name: Blight
Blight.description:
A creature that you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Plant creature automatically fails the save.

Alternatively, target a nonmagical plant that isn’t a creature, such as a tree or shrub. It doesn’t make a save; it simply withers and dies.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

Cloudkill.name: Cloudkill
Cloudkill.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of yellow-green fog centered on a point within range. The fog lasts for the duration or until strong wind (such as the one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it, ending the spell. Its area is Heavily Obscured.

Each creature in the Sphere makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 5d8 Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this save when the Sphere moves into its space and when it enters the Sphere or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

The Sphere moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Death Tyrant.description:
Death Tyrant

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Negative Energy Cone.name: Negative Energy Cone
Negative Energy Cone.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s central eye emits an imperceptible, magical wave of negative energy in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=TLqcxF6OYH0LweRo]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=TLqcxF6OYH0LweRo]]. [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=TLqcxF6OYH0LweRo]]. [[lookup @target.affects.type capitalize activity=TLqcxF6OYH0LweRo]]s in that area can’t regain Hit Points until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn. An intact Humanoid corpse there instantly rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmZombie00000000]{Zombie} under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s control and takes its turn immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]] on the same initiative count.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item .mmEyeRays0000000]] three times.

Eye Rays.name: Eye Rays
Eye Rays.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll [[/r 1d10]]; reroll if the beholder has already used that ray during this turn):

Eye Rays

1: Charm Ray.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=dcpGMW2jBewtY5lx]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=dcpGMW2jBewtY5lx]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for [[lookup @duration.value activity=dcpGMW2jBewtY5lx]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=dcpGMW2jBewtY5lx]] or until it takes damage.

Success: Half damage only.

2: Paralyzing Ray.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=EZ5rsyCFKBY3TWww]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=EZ5rsyCFKBY3TWww]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=EZ5rsyCFKBY3TWww]], it succeeds automatically.

3: Fear Ray.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=aMfevxGsYy5swVDA]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=aMfevxGsYy5swVDA]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

4: Slowing Ray.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=lq2AtXFOVBz6IHMh]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=lq2AtXFOVBz6IHMh]] damage. Until the end of the target’s next turn, the target’s Speed is halved; the target can’t take &Reference[Reaction]{Reactions}; and it can take either an action or a &Reference[BonusAction] on its turn, not both.

Success: Half damage only.

5: Enervation Ray.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=9srzVFm9txeDeMFf]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=9srzVFm9txeDeMFf]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Success: Half damage only.

6: Telekinetic Ray.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=a5zT8E1cS4yBVodK]] (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan).

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves the target up to [[lookup @target.template.size activity=a5zT8E1cS4yBVodK]] [[lookup @target.template.units activity=a5zT8E1cS4yBVodK]]. in any direction. The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn or until the beholder has the Incapacitated condition. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.

7: Sleep Ray.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=CSKrXM1Pkhlf23et]] (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead).

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for [[lookup @duration.value activity=CSKrXM1Pkhlf23et]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=CSKrXM1Pkhlf23et]]. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

8: Petrification Ray.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=q67AgIfRplRO2e9p]]. First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the &Reference[Petrified apply=false] condition instead of the Restrained condition.

9: Disintegration Ray.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=A5PdqZCq1yeIN8m4]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=A5PdqZCq1yeIN8m4]] damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=A5PdqZCq1yeIN8m4]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=A5PdqZCq1yeIN8m4]]. [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=A5PdqZCq1yeIN8m4]] of it disintegrates into dust.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 Hit Points, it disintegrates into dust.

10: Death Ray.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=yjLvFKZIWfUCIT73]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=yjLvFKZIWfUCIT73]] damage.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=yjLvFKZIWfUCIT73]] damage.

Failure or Success: The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 Hit Points.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for 1 minute.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn.

K1dTJYj98PUwPBTZ.name: Restrained
K1dTJYj98PUwPBTZ.description: First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Petrified.name: Petrified
Petrified.description: Second Failure: The target has the &Reference[Petrified apply=false] condition instead of the Restrained condition.

Half Speed/No Reactions.name: Half Speed/No Reactions
Half Speed/No Reactions.description: Until the end of the target’s next turn, the target’s Speed is halved; the target can’t take &Reference[Reaction]{Reactions}; and it can take either an action or a &Reference[BonusAction] on its turn, not both.

Agile.name: Agile
Agile.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t provoke an &Reference[opportunityattacks]{Opportunity Attack} when it moves out of an enemy’s reach.

Ram.name: Ram
Ram.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Demilich.description:
Demilich
