Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Undead Restoration.name: Undead Restoration
Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed, it reforms and regains all its Hit Points in [[/r 1d10]] days unless a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell is cast on its remains.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .8gPbaQO9kv9Ipevm]] attacks.

Necrotic Burst.name: Necrotic Burst
Necrotic Burst.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Howl.name: Howl
Howl.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=GzcwPXLq5lrc8kSK]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=GzcwPXLq5lrc8kSK]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=GzcwPXLq5lrc8kSK]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=GzcwPXLq5lrc8kSK]]. Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Failure or Success: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Energy Drain.name: Energy Drain
Energy Drain.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=3jwFie9se3ZA1RvG]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=3jwFie9se3ZA1RvG]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=3jwFie9se3ZA1RvG]] feet.

Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by 14 ([[/r 4d6]]).

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Grave-Dust Flight.name: Grave-Dust Flight
Grave-Dust Flight.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] flies up to its Fly Speed, shedding grave dust. Each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=jjHZ0sa9Ihw0qnC5]] within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=jjHZ0sa9Ihw0qnC5]]-feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] as it moves is targeted once by the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=jjHZ0sa9Ihw0qnC5]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the demilich’s next turn.

Exalted Restoration.name: Exalted Restoration
Exalted Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside Mount Celestia, its body disappears, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Mount Celestia.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Holy Mace]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommune000]{Commune}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRaiseDead0]{Raise Dead}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Commune.name: Commune
Commune.description:
You contact a deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren’t necessarily omniscient, so you might receive “unclear” as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity’s knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity’s interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

Raise Dead.name: Raise Dead
Raise Dead.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature if it has been dead no longer than 10 days and it wasn’t Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn’t restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 1)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 2)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 4)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 3)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Dire Worg.name: Dire Worg
Dire Worg.description:
Worgs

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.9wPwyBWpNGzAL7yb caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Dire Worg

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn. While Poisoned, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature’s next turn. While Poisoned, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Dreadful Howl.name: Dreadful Howl
Dreadful Howl.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=xToMbcg9i9oSf06f]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=xToMbcg9i9oSf06f]] within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=xToMbcg9i9oSf06f]] feet [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xToMbcg9i9oSf06f]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature’s next turn.

Warp Step.name: Warp Step
Warp Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports, along with [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]] of its choice within [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]] of it, up to [[lookup @range.value activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]] feet [[lookup @range.special activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]].

Avoidance.name: Avoidance
Avoidance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and half damage if it fails. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Displacement.name: Displacement
Displacement.description: Attack rolls against the [[lookup @name lowercase]] have Disadvantage, since it projects an illusion that makes it appear to be near its actual location. This trait is suppressed while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmTentacle000000]] attack.

Rend.name: Rend
Rend.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Elemental Restoration.name: Elemental Restoration
Elemental Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Elemental Plane of Air, its body dissolves into dirt, and it gains a new body in [[/r 1d4#Days]] days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Air.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Wishes.name: Wishes
Wishes.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a [[/r 1d100cs<31#Knows Wish on 1]]{30 percent} chance of knowing the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can understand. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the spell for the creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] suffers none of the spell’s stress. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has cast it three times, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t do so again for 365 days.

Wish.name: Wish
Wish.description:
Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter reality itself.

The basic use of this spell is to duplicate any other spell of level 8 or lower. If you use it this way, you don’t need to meet any requirements to cast that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect.

Alternatively, you can create one of the following effects of your choice:

Object Creation. You create one object of up to 25,000 GP in value that isn’t a magic item. The object can be no more than 300 feet in any dimension, and it appears in an unoccupied space that you can see on the ground.

Instant Health. You allow yourself and up to twenty creatures that you can see to regain all Hit Points, and you end all effects on them listed in the Greater Restoration spell.

Resistance. You grant up to ten creatures that you can see Resistance to one damage type that you choose. This Resistance is permanent.

Spell Immunity. You grant up to ten creatures you can see immunity to a single spell or other magical effect for 8 hours.

Sudden Learning. You replace one of your feats with another feat for which you are eligible. You lose all the benefits of the old feat and gain the benefits of the new one. You can’t replace a feat that is a prerequisite for any of your other feats or features.

Roll Redo. You undo a single recent event by forcing a reroll of any die roll made within the last round (including your last turn). Reality reshapes itself to accommodate the new result. For example, a Wish spell could undo an ally’s failed saving throw or a foe’s Critical Hit. You can force the reroll to be made with Advantage or Disadvantage, and you choose whether to use the reroll or the original roll.

Reshape Reality. You may wish for something not included in any of the other effects. To do so, state your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. The DM has great latitude in ruling what occurs in such an instance; the greater the wish, the greater the likelihood that something goes wrong. This spell might simply fail, the effect you desire might be achieved only in part, or you might suffer an unforeseen consequence as a result of how you worded the wish. For example, wishing that a villain were dead might propel you forward in time to a period when that villain is no longer alive, effectively removing you from the game. Similarly, wishing for a Legendary magic item or an Artifact might instantly transport you to the presence of the item’s current owner. If your wish is granted and its effects have consequences for a whole community, region, or world, you are likely to attract powerful foes. If your wish would affect a god, the god’s divine servants might instantly intervene to prevent it or to encourage you to craft the wish in a particular way. If your wish would undo the multiverse itself, threaten the City of Sigil, or affect the Lady of Pain in any way, you see an image of her in your mind for a moment; she shakes her head, and your wish fails.

The stress of casting Wish to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take 1d10 Necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for 2d4 days. For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a [[/r 1d3cs1]]{33 percent chance} that you are unable to cast Wish ever again if you suffer this stress.

Wish Stress.name: Wish Stress
Wish Stress.description: Each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take [[/damage 1d10 type=necrotic]] damage per level of that spell. This damage can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for [[/r 2d4]] days.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmStormBlade0000]] or [[/item .mmStormBolt00000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateFood]{Create Food and Water} (can create wine instead of water), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWindWalk00]{Wind Walk}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreation00]{Creation}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGaseousFor]{Gaseous Form}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Create Food and Water.name: Create Food and Water
Create Food and Water.description: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of fresh water on the ground or in containers within range—both useful in fending off the hazards of malnutrition and dehydration. The food is bland but nourishing and looks like a food of your choice, and the water is clean. The food spoils after 24 hours if uneaten.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Wind Walk.name: Wind Walk
Wind Walk.description:
You and up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range assume gaseous forms for the duration, appearing as wisps of cloud. While in this cloud form, a target has a Fly Speed of 300 feet and can hover; it has Immunity to the Prone condition; and it has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage. The only actions a target can take in this form are the &Reference[Dash] action or a Magic action to begin reverting to its normal form. Reverting takes 1 minute, during which the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition. Until the spell ends, the target can revert to cloud form, which also requires a Magic action followed by a 1-minute transformation.

If a target is in cloud form and flying when the effect ends, the target descends 60 feet per round for 1 minute until it lands, which it does safely. If it can’t land after 1 minute, it falls the remaining distance.

Cloud Form.name: Cloud Form
Cloud Form.description: The only actions a target can take in this form are the &Reference[Dash] action or a Magic action to begin reverting to its normal form. Reverting takes 1 minute, during which the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition. Until the spell ends, the target can revert to cloud form, which also requires a Magic action followed by a 1-minute transformation.

Creation.name: Creation
Creation.description:
You pull wisps of shadow material from the Shadowfell to create an object within range. It is either an object of vegetable matter (soft goods, rope, wood, and the like) or mineral matter (stone, crystal, metal, and the like). The object must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube, and the object must be of a form and material that you have seen.

The spell’s duration depends on the object’s material, as shown in the Materials table. If the object is composed of multiple materials, use the shortest duration. Using any object created by this spell as another spell’s Material component causes the other spell to fail.

MaterialDuration
Vegetable matter24 hours
Stone or crystal12 hours
Precious metals1 hour
Gems10 minutes
Adamantine or mithral1 minute

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Cube increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 5.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
A willing creature you touch shape-shifts, along with everything it’s wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends on the target if it drops to 0 Hit Points or if it takes a Magic action to end the spell on itself.

While in this form, the target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
The target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Create Whirlwind.name: Create Whirlwind
Create Whirlwind.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] conjures a whirlwind at a point it can see within 120 feet. The whirlwind fills a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=TYNKL0QDItFpbR2G]]-foot-radius, [[lookup @target.template.height activity=TYNKL0QDItFpbR2G]]-foot-high [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=TYNKL0QDItFpbR2G]] centered on that point. The whirlwind lasts until the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Concentration on it ends. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move the whirlwind up to 20 feet at the start of each of its turns.

Whenever the whirlwind enters a creature’s space or a creature enters the whirlwind, that creature is subjected to the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=TYNKL0QDItFpbR2G]] (a creature makes this save only once per turn, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is unaffected).

Failure: While in the whirlwind, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and moves with the whirlwind. At the start of each of its turns, the Restrained target takes [[/damage average]] damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description:
The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and moves with the whirlwind.

At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Storm Bolt.name: Storm Bolt
Storm Bolt.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmSlam0000000000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmUnsettlingVisa]] if available.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: [[/attack]] ([[lookup @activation.condition activity=mEQjWdqU7zGv6Ott]]), reach [[lookup @range.value activity=mEQjWdqU7zGv6Ott]] [[lookup @range.units activity=mEQjWdqU7zGv6Ott]]. [[/damage average extended]].

attack.condition: with Advantage during the first round of each combat

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]]).

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Unsettling Visage.name: Unsettling Visage
Unsettling Visage.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]], it succeeds automatically.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=EU2q25V5hIaM1ZlR]], or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Dracolich.name: Dracolich
Dracolich.description:
Dracolich

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.IHoaZrAmth1TcD6m caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Dracolich Lairs

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.onfvCULmDEbXGgra caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Life Suppression.name: Life Suppression
Life Suppression.description: Creatures within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=n7LC7M3BMXe8n2Ro]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t regain Hit Points.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Soul Gem.name: Soul Gem
Soul Gem.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a magical gem. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed while the gem is on the same plane of existence as it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a new body in [[/r 1d20]] days, regaining all its Hit Points and appearing within 5 feet of the gem.

The gem is a Tiny object that has AC 20; HP 50; and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The gem regains all its Hit Points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points. If the gem is destroyed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can create a new one by completing an 8-hour ritual using a gem worth 1,000+ GP and by expending 5,000 GP, which the ritual consumes.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dracolich makes three [[/item .KVgeVIHhqlrLNLD0]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRayofSickn]{Ray of Sickness} (level 2 version).

Necrotic Breath.name: Necrotic Breath
Necrotic Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=3LncbUYMp4rOrQ3U]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=3LncbUYMp4rOrQ3U]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=3LncbUYMp4rOrQ3U]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item .KVgeVIHhqlrLNLD0]] attack.

Sickening Ray.name: Sickening Ray
Sickening Ray.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting to cast [[/item .hkpO8GXAHAtvY86z.Activity.5n39jOq2X004GaG6]] (level 2 version). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Ray of Sickness.name: Ray of Sickness
Ray of Sickness.description:
You shoot a greenish ray at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 Poison damage and has the &Reference[poisoned] condition until the end of your next turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Terrifying Presence.name: Terrifying Presence
Terrifying Presence.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=SVb8yS9ewkeZpP2R]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=SVb8yS9ewkeZpP2R]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=SVb8yS9ewkeZpP2R]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: Half damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +11 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRayofSickn]{Ray of Sickness} (level 2 version)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateUnde]{Create Undead} (level 8 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFingerofDe]{Finger of Death}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Create Undead.name: Create Undead
Create Undead.description:
You can cast this spell only at night. Choose up to three corpses of Medium or Small Humanoids within range. Each one becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.OBujQLLPSmlJiZnL]{Ghoul} under your control (see the Monster Manual for its stat block).

As a Bonus Action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any of them at the same time, issuing the same command to them). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move on its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular place. If you issue no commands, the creature takes the &Reference[Dodge] action and moves only to avoid harm. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow the order until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you’ve given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to three creatures you have animated with this spell rather than animating new ones.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.If you use a level 7 spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over four Ghouls. If you use a level 8 spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over five Ghouls or two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.IyIybE5t2adMEVUM]{Ghasts} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{Wights}. If you use a level 9 spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over six Ghouls, three Ghasts or Wights, or two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.t8WYD7ak07X7xpx8]{Mummies}. See the Monster Manual for these stat blocks.

Finger of Death.name: Finger of Death
Finger of Death.description:
You unleash negative energy toward a creature you can see within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 7d8 + 30 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

A Humanoid killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobZombie0000]{Zombie} (see appendix B) that follows your verbal orders.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a [[/item .mmTail0000000000]].

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Steam Breath.name: Steam Breath
Steam Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5iI1KQRWrdMGh9sy]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=5iI1KQRWrdMGh9sy]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=5iI1KQRWrdMGh9sy]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Being underwater doesn’t grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

Dretch.name: Dretch
Dretch.description:
Dretches

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.Tp3r2uMnilo9SUIu caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Dretch

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.YeZoNZxhdDHR3iC2 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Fetid Cloud.name: Fetid Cloud
Fetid Cloud.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=vRnhmBCQqIwIlfS4]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=vRnhmBCQqIwIlfS4]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the creature can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both, and it can’t take Reactions.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the creature can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both, and it can’t take Reactions.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmForeleg0000000]] or [[/item .mmPoisonBurst000]] in any combination.

Magic of the Spider Queen.name: Magic of the Spider Queen
Magic of the Spider Queen.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWeb0000000]{Web}, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]).

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can’t see through it, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn’t being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are &Reference[difficultterrain], and the area within them is &Reference[lightlyobscured].

If the webs aren’t anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

The first time a creature enters the webs on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained] condition while in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature Restrained by the webs can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer Restrained.

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot Cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing [[/damage 2d4 type=fire]] damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

Druid.name: Druid
Druid.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmStuddedLea]{Studded Leather Armor}

Druid

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.YHhY8teRtbcSR64M caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmVineStaff00000]] or [[/item .mmVerdantWisp000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThunderwav]{Thunderwave}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAnimalMess]{Animal Messenger}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLongstride]{Longstrider}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMoonbeam00]{Moonbeam}

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
你向自然精魂低语，在施法距离内创造出下述效应之一。

感知天气。 你创造一个微型而无害的感官效应，并以之预报你所在地接下来 4 小时的天气状况。该效应可表现为一个代表晴空的金球，一朵代表雨天的云彩，代表雪日而飘飞的雪花等等。该效应将持续 1 轮。

盛放。 你可以立即让一朵鲜花绽放，一颗种子破壳，一片叶蕾发芽。

感官效应。 你创造一个无害的感官效应，例如落叶，幽灵般舞动的小仙灵们，微风，动物的声音或者臭鼬的微弱臭气。该效应只能在 5 尺的立方空间内起效。

玩火。 你点亮或熄灭一根蜡烛、一根火把或一处小篝火。

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action’s skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don’t pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Animal Messenger.name: Animal Messenger
Animal Messenger.description:
A Tiny Beast of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or it attempts to deliver a message for you (if the target’s Challenge Rating isn’t 0, it automatically succeeds). You specify a location you have visited and a recipient who matches a general description, such as “a person dressed in the uniform of the town guard” or “a red-haired dwarf wearing a pointed hat.” You also communicate a message of up to twenty-five words. The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn’t reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell’s duration increases by 48 hours for each spell slot level above 2.

Carrying Message.name: Carrying Message
Carrying Message.description:
The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn’t reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description:
You touch a creature. The target’s Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description: The target’s Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Moonbeam.name: Moonbeam
Moonbeam.description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the Cylinder, and you can take a Magic action on later turns to move the Cylinder up to 60 feet.

When the Cylinder appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 Radiant damage, and if the creature is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example), it reverts to its true form and can’t shape-shift until it leaves the Cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the spell’s area moves into its space and when it enters the spell’s area or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 2.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Speak with Beasts and Plants.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
Speak with Beasts and Plants.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动一次 [[/item .mmVineLash000000]] 或 [[/item .mmThornBurst0000]] 攻击，并使用施法施展 [[/item .mmSpellcasting00.Activity.bAmZSyK4cn33HwwI]]。

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAnimalFrie]{Animal Friendship}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCharmMonst]{Charm Monster} (lasts 24 hours; ends early if the dryad casts the spell again), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPasswithou]{Pass without Trace}

Tree Stride.name: Tree Stride
Tree Stride.description: If within [[lookup @range.value activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] feet of a [[lookup @range.special activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to an unoccupied space within [[lookup @range.value activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] feet of a second [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] that is within 60 feet of the previous tree.

Animal Friendship.name: Animal Friendship
Animal Friendship.description:
Target a Beast that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Beast for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Charm Monster.name: Charm Monster
Charm Monster.description:
One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with Advantage if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
你向自然精魂低语，在施法距离内创造出下述效应之一。

感知天气。 你创造一个微型而无害的感官效应，并以之预报你所在地接下来 4 小时的天气状况。该效应可表现为一个代表晴空的金球，一朵代表雨天的云彩，代表雪日而飘飞的雪花等等。该效应将持续 1 轮。

盛放。 你可以立即让一朵鲜花绽放，一颗种子破壳，一片叶蕾发芽。

感官效应。 你创造一个无害的感官效应，例如落叶，幽灵般舞动的小仙灵们，微风，动物的声音或者臭鼬的微弱臭气。该效应只能在 5 尺的立方空间内起效。

玩火。 你点亮或熄灭一根蜡烛、一根火把或一处小篝火。

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Pass without Trace.name: Pass without Trace
Pass without Trace.description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Concealed.name: Concealed
Concealed.description: While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Dust Mephit.name: Dust Mephit
Dust Mephit.description:
Mephits

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.C5AnYUB2Vhu0urqS caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Dust Mephit

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.hX5LRqqZKKcvWC4l caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] explodes [[lookup @activation.condition activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]].

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Blinding Breath.name: Blinding Breath
Blinding Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=soAO2jRWos8FsxeU]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=soAO2jRWos8FsxeU]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the user's next turn.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSleep00000] spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]).

CF13ievxQ48W9L9w.name: Sleep
CF13ievxQ48W9L9w.description:
Each creature of your choice in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Creatures that don’t sleep, such as elves, or that have Immunity to the Exhaustion condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

Sleeping.name: Sleeping
Sleeping.description: The target has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t disturb the material it moves through.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] deals double damage to objects and structures.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmSlam0000000000]] or [[/item .mmRockLaunch0000]] in any combination.

Rock Launch.name: Rock Launch
Rock Launch.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Elemental Restoration.name: Elemental Restoration
Elemental Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @item.requirements]], its body dissolves into dirt, and it gains a new body in [[/r 1d4#Days]] days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Fire.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Wishes.name: Wishes
Wishes.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a [[/r 1d100cs<31#Knows Wish on 1]]{30 percent} chance of knowing the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can understand. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the spell for the creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] suffers none of the spell’s stress. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has cast it three times, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t do so again for 365 days.

Wish.name: Wish
Wish.description:
Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter reality itself.

The basic use of this spell is to duplicate any other spell of level 8 or lower. If you use it this way, you don’t need to meet any requirements to cast that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect.

Alternatively, you can create one of the following effects of your choice:

Object Creation. You create one object of up to 25,000 GP in value that isn’t a magic item. The object can be no more than 300 feet in any dimension, and it appears in an unoccupied space that you can see on the ground.

Instant Health. You allow yourself and up to twenty creatures that you can see to regain all Hit Points, and you end all effects on them listed in the Greater Restoration spell.

Resistance. You grant up to ten creatures that you can see Resistance to one damage type that you choose. This Resistance is permanent.

Spell Immunity. You grant up to ten creatures you can see immunity to a single spell or other magical effect for 8 hours.

Sudden Learning. You replace one of your feats with another feat for which you are eligible. You lose all the benefits of the old feat and gain the benefits of the new one. You can’t replace a feat that is a prerequisite for any of your other feats or features.

Roll Redo. You undo a single recent event by forcing a reroll of any die roll made within the last round (including your last turn). Reality reshapes itself to accommodate the new result. For example, a Wish spell could undo an ally’s failed saving throw or a foe’s Critical Hit. You can force the reroll to be made with Advantage or Disadvantage, and you choose whether to use the reroll or the original roll.

Reshape Reality. You may wish for something not included in any of the other effects. To do so, state your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. The DM has great latitude in ruling what occurs in such an instance; the greater the wish, the greater the likelihood that something goes wrong. This spell might simply fail, the effect you desire might be achieved only in part, or you might suffer an unforeseen consequence as a result of how you worded the wish. For example, wishing that a villain were dead might propel you forward in time to a period when that villain is no longer alive, effectively removing you from the game. Similarly, wishing for a Legendary magic item or an Artifact might instantly transport you to the presence of the item’s current owner. If your wish is granted and its effects have consequences for a whole community, region, or world, you are likely to attract powerful foes. If your wish would affect a god, the god’s divine servants might instantly intervene to prevent it or to encourage you to craft the wish in a particular way. If your wish would undo the multiverse itself, threaten the City of Sigil, or affect the Lady of Pain in any way, you see an image of her in your mind for a moment; she shakes her head, and your wish fails.

The stress of casting Wish to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take 1d10 Necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for 2d4 days. For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a [[/r 1d3cs1]]{33 percent chance} that you are unable to cast Wish ever again if you suffer this stress.

Wish Stress.name: Wish Stress
Wish Stress.description: Each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take [[/damage 1d10 type=necrotic]] damage per level of that spell. This damage can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for [[/r 2d4]] days.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmHeatedBlade000]] or [[/item .mmHurlFlame00000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplElementali]{Elementalism}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGaseousFor]{Gaseous Form}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWallofFire]{Wall of Fire} (level 7 version)

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Elementalism.name: Elementalism
Elementalism.description:
You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range.

Beckon Air. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot Cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren’t affected.

Beckon Earth. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

Beckon Fire. You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and colored, scented smoke in a 5-foot Cube. You choose the color and scent, and the embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke’s scent lingers for 1 minute.

Beckon Water. You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens creatures and objects in a 5-foot Cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a surface, and the water evaporates in 1 minute.

Sculpt Element. You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1-foot Cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature) for 1 hour.

Beckon Element.name: Beckon Element
Beckon Element.chatFlavor: Fire and water beckoning lasts for 1 minute

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
A willing creature you touch shape-shifts, along with everything it’s wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends on the target if it drops to 0 Hit Points or if it takes a Magic action to end the spell on itself.

While in this form, the target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
The target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Wall of Fire.name: Wall of Fire
Wall of Fire.description:
You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d8 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 Fire damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t disturb the material it moves through.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] deals double damage to objects and structures.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmElementalBurst]] attacks.
