Elemental Burst.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]] ([[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice).

Cataclysmic Event.name: Cataclysmic Event
Cataclysmic Event.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] creates one of the following effects at random (roll [[/r 1d4#Cataclysmic Event]]):

1: Clinging Flames.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=tUJIM74oC6JUcDJC]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=tUJIM74oC6JUcDJC]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=tUJIM74oC6JUcDJC]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=tUJIM74oC6JUcDJC]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: The target starts &Reference[burning].

2: Freezing Waves.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=rF7ttNDNWDfvxxkl]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=rF7ttNDNWDfvxxkl]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=rF7ttNDNWDfvxxkl]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: The target’s Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

3: Raging Storm. A storm cloud fills a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=RNZgZ52YOGGAg1zj]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=RNZgZ52YOGGAg1zj]] feet. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Cataclysmic Event again. Creatures entirely in the cloud have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions and can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=RNZgZ52YOGGAg1zj]], each creature that enters the cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=RNZgZ52YOGGAg1zj]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

4: Swallowing Earth.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=sJ4avTypqPGWDLlD]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=sJ4avTypqPGWDLlD]]-foot Cube originating from a point on the ground within [[lookup @range.value activity=sJ4avTypqPGWDLlD]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=sJ4avTypqPGWDLlD]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition and is buried under rubble. A buried target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, has &Reference[Total Cover], and is &Reference[suffocating]. As an action, a buried creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@skills.ath.passive format=long]]. On a successful check, the creature is no longer buried.

Success: Half damage only.

Buried: Escape Check.name: Buried: Escape Check
Buried: Escape Check.condition: an action taken by the buried creature or a creature within range

Freezing Waves: Zero Speed.name: Freezing Waves: Zero Speed
Freezing Waves: Zero Speed.description: The target’s Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

Raging Storm: Blind, Deaf, Verbal Compon.name: Raging Storm: Blind, Deaf, Verbal Components
Raging Storm: Blind, Deaf, Verbal Compon.description: Creatures entirely in the cloud have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions and can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description:
2: Freezing Waves. The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition

4: Swallowing Earth. The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition and is buried under rubble.

Swallowing Earth: Restrained, Cover, Suf.name: Swallowing Earth: Restrained, Cover, Suffocating
Swallowing Earth: Restrained, Cover, Suf.description: A buried target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, has &Reference[Total Cover], and is &Reference[suffocating]. As an action, a buried creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long] (see source for escape DC). On a successful check, the creature is no longer buried.

Control Weather.name: Control Weather
Control Weather.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplControlWea]{Control Weather} spell, requiring no spell components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability.

ri3lPsbel2GU2ONO.name: Control Weather
ri3lPsbel2GU2ONO.description:
You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, and it ends early if you go indoors.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes 1d4 × 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.

When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can change its direction.

Precipitation
StageCondition
1Clear
2Light clouds
3Overcast or ground fog
4Rain, hail, or snow
5Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard
Temperature
StageCondition
1Heat wave
2Hot
3Warm
4Cool
5Cold
6Freezing
Wind
StageCondition
1Calm
2Moderate wind
3Strong wind
4Gale
5Storm

Rumbling Movement.name: Rumbling Movement
Rumbling Movement.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed, Fly Speed, or Swim Speed without provoking &Reference[OpportunityAttacks].

Each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=6LnRjVsoOrDcYSqw]] within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=6LnRjVsoOrDcYSqw]] [[lookup @target.template.units activity=6LnRjVsoOrDcYSqw]]. of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] as it moves is targeted once by the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=6LnRjVsoOrDcYSqw]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) that will modify this creature's damage resistances. You can enable the damage resistance of your choice in the character sheet's effects tab.

Beckon Air. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot Cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren’t affected.

Beckon Earth. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

Beckon Element.name: Beckon Element
Beckon Element.chatFlavor: Fire and water beckoning lasts for 1 minute

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCalmEmotio]{Calm Emotions}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPasswithou]{Pass without Trace}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWaterBreat]{Water Breathing}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommune000]{Commune}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}

Calm Emotions.name: Calm Emotions
Calm Emotions.description:
Each Humanoid in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects (choose for each creature):

  • The creature has Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions until the spell ends. If the creature was already Charmed or Frightened, those conditions are suppressed for the duration.
  • The creature becomes Indifferent about creatures of your choice that it’s Hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target takes damage or witnesses its allies taking damage. When the spell ends, the creature’s attitude returns to normal.

Calmed.name: Calmed
Calmed.description: The creature has Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions until the spell ends. If the creature was already Charmed or Frightened, those conditions are suppressed for the duration.

Indifference.name: Indifference
Indifference.description: The creature becomes Indifferent about creatures of your choice that it’s Hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target takes damage or witnesses its allies taking damage. When the spell ends, the creature’s attitude returns to normal.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target’s Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target’s Hit Point maximum

Pass without Trace.name: Pass without Trace
Pass without Trace.description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Concealed.name: Concealed
Concealed.description: While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Water Breathing.name: Water Breathing
Water Breathing.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

Commune.name: Commune
Commune.description:
You contact a deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren’t necessarily omniscient, so you might receive “unclear” as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity’s knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity’s interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

Dispel Evil and Good.name: Dispel Evil and Good
Dispel Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.

Break Enchantment. As a Magic action, you touch a creature that is possessed by or has the &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Frightened] condition from one or more creatures of the types above. The target is no longer possessed, Charmed, or Frightened by such creatures.

Dismissal. As a Magic action, you target one creature you can see within 5 feet of you that has one of the creature types above. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be sent back to its home plane if it isn’t there already. If they aren’t on their home plane, Undead are sent to the Shadowfell, and Fey are sent to the Feywild.

Dispelling Evil and Good.name: Dispelling Evil and Good
Dispelling Evil and Good.description: For the duration, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions: Break Enchantment or Dismissal.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Bolster.name: Bolster
Bolster.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=v5km8Vio4N6HgkF6]] Temporary Hit Points, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and each ally within [[lookup @range.value activity=v5km8Vio4N6HgkF6]] feet of it gain Advantage on D20 Tests until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Bolstered: Test Advantage.name: Bolstered: Test Advantage
Bolstered: Test Advantage.description: The target gains Advantage on D20 Tests until the end of the user's next turn.

Shockwave of Glory.name: Shockwave of Glory
Shockwave of Glory.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=D9xmcR92PLqyk6bZ]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=D9xmcR92PLqyk6bZ]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=D9xmcR92PLqyk6bZ]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Smite.name: Smite
Smite.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Divine Ray]] attack.

Empyrean Iota.name: Empyrean Iota
Empyrean Iota.description:
Empyreans

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.EeghH4EY0e0ozOgz caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Empyrean Iota

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.UfP3XBh5DPF3cHCM caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Otherworldly Strike.name: Otherworldly Strike
Otherworldly Strike.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage ([[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice).

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration} (as an action)

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

myomZEnYjGO4ePQh.name: Healing Word
myomZEnYjGO4ePQh.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Diabolical Restoration.name: Diabolical Restoration
Diabolical Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Magic Rope.name: Magic Rope
Magic Rope.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a magic rope. While bearing it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use the [[/item .mmEntanglingRope]] action. The rope has AC 20, HP 90, and Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The rope turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points, if it is 5+ feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour or more, or if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies. If the rope is damaged or destroyed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can fully restore it when finishing a Short or Long Rest.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmWitheringSword]] attacks and can use [[/item .mmEntanglingRope]].

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Entangling Rope.name: Entangling Rope
Entangling Rope.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=n8nEah4vbrEPphNF]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=n8nEah4vbrEPphNF]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the rope is destroyed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses a Bonus Action to release the target, or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Entangling Rope again.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the rope is destroyed.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Web Strand.name: Web Strand
Web Strand.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Ln5NXBaHGKlwdoiP]], one Large or smaller [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Ln5NXBaHGKlwdoiP]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Ln5NXBaHGKlwdoiP]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage).

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the web is destroyed.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attack.

Reel.name: Reel
Reel.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=jWkEQYHBd7aht1kG]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=jWkEQYHBd7aht1kG]] feet of itself that is Restrained by its Web Strand up to 25 feet straight toward itself.

Battleaxe.name: Battleaxe
Battleaxe.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Morningstar.name: Morningstar
Morningstar.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Next Attack: Disadv..name: Next Attack: Disadv.
Next Attack: Disadv..description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .2zUJENAN0VZgqxYm]] attack and one [[/item .5LN8JEIko2tgE2WO]] attack.

Faerie Dragon Adult.name: Faerie Dragon Adult
Faerie Dragon Adult.description:
Faerie Dragons

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.AqBgo4Po2QO1WBkC caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Faerie Dragon Adult

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.2YePImjgR84EIBWl caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Euphoria Breath.name: Euphoria Breath
Euphoria Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]], it succeeds automatically. While Incapacitated, the target uses all its movement on each of its turns to move in a random direction.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallucinat]{Hallucinatory Terrain}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph}

Superior Invisibility.name: Superior Invisibility
Superior Invisibility.description: The dragon casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterInv]{Greater Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: A creature you touch has the Invisible condition until the spell ends.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell’s range.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Hallucinatory Terrain.name: Hallucinatory Terrain
Hallucinatory Terrain.description:
You make natural terrain in a 150-foot Cube in range look, sound, and smell like another sort of natural terrain. Thus, open fields or a road can be made to resemble a swamp, hill, crevasse, or some other difficult or impassable terrain. A pond can be made to seem like a grassy meadow, a precipice like a gentle slope, or a rock-strewn gully like a wide and smooth road. Manufactured structures, equipment, and creatures within the area aren’t changed.

The tactile characteristics of the terrain are unchanged, so creatures entering the area are likely to notice the illusion. If the difference isn’t obvious by touch, a creature examining the illusion can take the Study action to make an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC to disbelieve it. If a creature discerns that the terrain is illusory, the creature sees a vague image superimposed on the real terrain.

Polymorph.name: Polymorph
Polymorph.description:
You attempt to transform a creature that you can see within range into a Beast. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or shape-shift into a Beast form for the duration. That form can be any Beast you choose that has a Challenge Rating equal to or less than the target’s (or the target’s level if it doesn’t have a Challenge Rating). The target’s game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen Beast, but the target retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Hit Points, and Hit Point Dice. See appendix B for a sample of Beast stat blocks.

The target gains a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the Beast form. The spell ends early on the target if it has no Temporary Hit Points left.

The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can’t speak or cast spells.

The target’s gear melds into the new form. The creature can’t use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

Faerie Dragon Youth.name: Faerie Dragon Youth
Faerie Dragon Youth.description:
Faerie Dragons

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.AqBgo4Po2QO1WBkC caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Faerie Dragon Youth

Euphoria Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Q6P0Nz8WgIKLlnNT]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns and uses all its movement on its turn to move in a random direction.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

Superior Invisibility.description: The dragon casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterInv]{Greater Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Fiend Cultist.name: Fiend Cultist
Fiend Cultist.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmBreastplat]{Breastplate}

Cultists

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VICfYukXoYkWJ1yn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.AR1qFw34j7YLQUwO caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmPactAxe0000000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +7 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray} (level 5 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (level 6 version)

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHellishReb]{Hellish Rebuke} in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

JKj2mFhjY5PxpL16.name: Hellish Rebuke
JKj2mFhjY5PxpL16.description:
The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You hurl three fiery rays. You can hurl them at one target within range or at several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 Fire damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create one additional ray for each spell slot level above 2.

[[@item.level + 1]]{Total Rays}

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Fire Aura.name: Fire Aura
Fire Aura.description: At the end of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage. Creatures and flammable objects in the Emanation start burning.

Fire Form.name: Fire Form
Fire Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so, and it can enter a creature’s space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet.

Water Susceptibility.name: Water Susceptibility
Water Susceptibility.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 3 (1d6) Cold damage damage for every 5 feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves in water or for every gallon of water splashed on it.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured to roll the correct number of dice based on the distance traveled through water. 1 is default for 5 feet, 2 is for 10 feet, and so forth.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBurn0000000000]] attacks.

Undead Restoration.name: Undead Restoration
Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed before it atones for its evil, it gains a new body in [[/r 1d10]] days, reviving with all its Hit Points. The new body appears in a location significant to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile} (level 2 version)

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart strikes a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell creates one more dart for each spell slot level above 1.

[[2 + @item.level]]{Level [[lookup @item.level]] darts}

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Aversion to Fire.name: Aversion to Fire
Aversion to Fire.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Averse.name: Averse
Averse.description: It has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] starts its turn &Reference[Bloodied], roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a 6, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks an object. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s creator, if within [[lookup @range.value activity=tnkOsrSwEElO2kZM]] feet of the berserk [[lookup @name lowercase]], can try to calm it by taking an action to make a [[/check ability=cha skill=per dc=@abilities.str.dc]] DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check; the golem must be able to hear its creator. If this check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk until the start of its next turn, at which point it resumes rolling for the Berserk trait again if it is still Bloodied.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description: On each of its turns while berserk, the creature attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the creature attacks an object. Once the creature goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer &Reference[Bloodied apply=false].

Lightning Absorption.name: Lightning Absorption
Lightning Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance

Advanced Telepathy.name: Advanced Telepathy
Advanced Telepathy.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] perceives the content of any telepathic communication within 60 feet of it.

Prone Deficiency.name: Prone Deficiency
Prone Deficiency.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] receives the Prone condition, roll a die. On an odd number, it has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. At the end of each of its turns, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=LfYXT04YlFJUhscb]] Dexterity saving throw, ending the Incapacitated condition on a success.

Roll a Die.name: Roll a Die
Roll a Die.chatFlavor: On an odd number, it has the Incapacitated condition.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: On an odd number, it has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Telepathic Shroud.name: Telepathic Shroud
Telepathic Shroud.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s thoughts can’t be read by any means, and magic can’t detect its location or observe it remotely.

Stench Spray.name: Stench Spray
Stench Spray.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.formula activity=MD1NjuNJfDjxKGrL]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=MD1NjuNJfDjxKGrL]] the [[lookup @name]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=MD1NjuNJfDjxKGrL]] feet.

Failure: The target is coated in a foul-smelling liquid, exudes a stench for [[/r 1d4]] hours, and has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition while the stench lasts. Other creatures have the Poisoned condition while in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the coated target. The target can remove the stench on itself if it bathes during a Short or Long Rest.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target is coated in a foul-smelling liquid for [[/r 1d4]] hours and has the &Reference[Poisoned] condition while the stench lasts. Other creatures within a 5-foot emanation of the coated target also have the Poisoned condition. The target can remove the stench on itself if it bathes during a Short or Long Rest.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t provoke an &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]{Opportunity Attack} when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .Eba7VT2YBJ5cHYyK]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmWarpingHex0000]] if available.

Warping Hex.name: Warping Hex
Warping Hex.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=KaTc2c6hOHAqtywC]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=KaTc2c6hOHAqtywC]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=KaTc2c6hOHAqtywC]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level.

Success: Half damage only.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect that will modify the target.  Since the Exhaustion condition can be applied multiple times, the Active Effect must be dragged from this item’s Effects tab onto the target item’s sheet after the initial application of the Exhaustion condition.

Exhaustion.name: Exhaustion
Exhaustion.description: The target of the attack from the attacking creature gains one &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level.

Animate Boulders.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] animates [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=lydBv987ChZ7itoS]] it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=lydBv987ChZ7itoS]] feet of itself. Each boulder uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGalebDuhr00000] stat block, except it has Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1 and lacks this action. The boulder takes its turn immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]] on the same Initiative count, and it obeys the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. A boulder remains animate for [[lookup @duration.value activity=lydBv987ChZ7itoS]] minute or until it or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies.

After [[/r 2d6#Days]] days, they become Large and have 13 Hit Points.

Ooze Cube.name: Ooze Cube
Ooze Cube.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] fills its entire space and is transparent. Other creatures can enter that space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Engulf and has Disadvantage on the saving throw.

Creatures inside the [[lookup @name lowercase]] have &Reference[Total Cover], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hold one Large creature or up to four Medium or Small creatures inside itself at a time.

As an action, a creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=EcTOfXWsDJRHLydy]] [[lookup @range.units activity=EcTOfXWsDJRHLydy]]. of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pull a creature or an object out of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by succeeding on a [[/check dc=12 ability=str skill=ath format=long]], and the puller takes [[/damage average activity=PMCvyqxfUYiPzNK8]] damage.

Total Cover.name: Total Cover
Total Cover.description: Creatures inside the attacking creature have Total Cover.

Transparent.name: Transparent
Transparent.description: Even when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is in plain sight, a creature must succeed on a [[/check dc=15 ability=wis skill=prc format=long]] to notice the [[lookup @name lowercase]] if the creature hasn’t witnessed the [[lookup @name lowercase]] move or otherwise act.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures if it has room inside itself to contain them (see the @UUID[.mmOozeCube000000] trait).

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5o0Bh8PQaojx5XMx]], each creature whose space the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters for the first time during this move.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is engulfed. An engulfed target is &Reference[suffocating], can’t cast spells with a Verbal component, has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, and takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the engulfed target moves with it. An engulfed target can try to escape by taking an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@abilities.str.dc]] check. On a successful check, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

Success: Half damage, and the target moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s. If there is no unoccupied space, the target fails the save instead.

Total Cover, Suffocating & Restrained.name: Total Cover, Suffocating & Restrained
Total Cover, Suffocating & Restrained.description: An engulfed target is &Reference[suffocating], can’t cast spells with a Verbal component, has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, and takes [[/damage average 3d6 type=acid]] damage at the start of each of the user's turns.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]], any creature (other than a [[lookup @name lowercase]]) that starts its turn in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .yf1Nf7oPWS4arOOL]] attacks.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.name: Etherealness
88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can’t see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane can’t perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn’t border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Failure: The target is possessed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]; the [[lookup @name lowercase]] disappears, and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target’s Speed, as well as the target’s Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost’s Possession for 24 hours.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Possession for 24 hours.

Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplClairvoyan]{Clairvoyance}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Clairvoyance.name: Clairvoyance
Clairvoyance.description:
You create an Invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The intangible, invulnerable sensor remains in place for the duration.

When you cast the spell, choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As a Bonus Action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

A creature that sees the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from See Invisibility or &Reference[truesight]) sees a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=kONz26XFQN0nYcDS]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=kONz26XFQN0nYcDS]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=kONz26XFQN0nYcDS]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=kONz26XFQN0nYcDS]] Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand} (the hand is Invisible)

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplNondetecti]{Nondetection} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Nondetection.name: Nondetection
Nondetection.description: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from Divination spells. The target can be a willing creature, or it can be a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. The target can’t be targeted by any Divination spell or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

hZJioW2A77dHS3nP.name: Misty Step
hZJioW2A77dHS3nP.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Githyanki Knight.description:

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Silver Sword]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTelekinesi]{Telekinesis} if available.

Silver Sword.name: Silver Sword
Silver Sword.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Critical Hit: If the target is in an astral body (as with the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAstralProj]{Astral Projection} spell), the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cut the silvery cord that tethers the target to its material body instead of dealing damage.

Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no {type} components and using {ability} as the spellcasting ability:

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplNondetecti]{Nondetection} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTelekinesi]{Telekinesis}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Nondetection.name: Nondetection
Nondetection.description: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from Divination spells. The target can be a willing creature, or it can be a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. The target can’t be targeted by any Divination spell or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
Telekinesis.description:
You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought. When you cast the spell and as a Magic action on your later turns before the spell ends, you can exert your will on one creature or object that you can see within range, causing the appropriate effect below. You can affect the same target round after round or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell.

Creature. You can try to move a Huge or smaller creature. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or you move it up to 30 feet in any direction within the spell’s range. Until the end of your next turn, the creature has the &Reference[Restrained] condition, and if you lift it into the air, it is suspended there. It falls at the end of your next turn unless you use this option on it again and it fails the save.

Object. You can try to move a Huge or smaller object. If the object isn’t being worn or carried, you automatically move it up to 30 feet in any direction within the spell’s range.

If the object is worn or carried by a creature, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or you pull the object away and move it up to 30 feet in any direction within the spell’s range.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, stowing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

K191ZU4UrvUcJQ4f.name: Misty Step
K191ZU4UrvUcJQ4f.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand} (the hand is Invisible)

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSeeInvisib]{See Invisibility}

Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

Psionic Defense.name: Psionic Defense
Psionic Defense.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFeatherFal]{Feather Fall} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell’s trigger, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature’s rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Psi-Powered Leap.name: Psi-Powered Leap
Psi-Powered Leap.description: The githyanki casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplJump000000]{Jump}, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Jump.name: Jump
Jump.description:
You touch a willing creature. Once on each of its turns until the spell ends, that creature can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Jump.name: Jump

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
Phantasmal Killer.description:
You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see within range and create an illusion of its deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 4d10 Psychic damage and has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the spell ends.

For the duration, the target makes a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spelldc]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes the Psychic damage again. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 4.

Fears Manifested.name: Fears Manifested
Fears Manifested.description:
The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for the duration.

For the duration, the target makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes the Psychic damage again. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Demonic Restoration.name: Demonic Restoration
Demonic Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmPincer00000000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmPummel00000000]] or [[/item .mmSpellcasting00]].

Pincer.name: Pincer
Pincer.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two pincers.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC).

Pummel.name: Pummel
Pummel.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=aae828c0Hue0XOMP]], one creature Grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplConfusion0]{Confusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPowerWordS]{Power Word Stun}

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can’t see through it, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn’t being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or that target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.tables.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Sphere’s radius increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Confused.name: Confused
Confused.description:
The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.tables.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Power Word Stun.name: Power Word Stun

The &Reference[Stunned apply=false] target makes a [[/save ability=con dc=@attributes.spelldc]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.

Stunned.description: The &Reference[Stunned apply=false] target makes a [[/save ability=con]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBlindnessD]{Blindness/Deafness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGrease0000]{Grease}

Jinx.name: Jinx
Jinx.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see hits it with an attack roll.

Response—Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=02KFzL9fElzyHOIT]], the triggering creature.

Failure: The attack misses instead.

Save.name: Save
Save.condition: A creature the goblin can see hits it with an attack roll.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Grease.name: Grease
Grease.description:
Nonflammable grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into &Reference[difficultterrain] for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[prone] condition. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on that save or fall Prone.
