Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it revives 24 hours later unless @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} is cast on its remains. If it revives, it animates another group of corpses elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

Suffocate.name: Suffocate
Suffocate.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[suffocating apply=false]{suffocating}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have up to two targets Grappled in this way at a time.

Grappled & Suffocating.name: Grappled & Suffocating
Grappled & Suffocating.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC). Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[suffocating apply=false]{suffocating}.

Haunting Glare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=kIxd4BuhFya6117b]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=kIxd4BuhFya6117b]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=kIxd4BuhFya6117b]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=kIxd4BuhFya6117b]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=kIxd4BuhFya6117b]], it succeeds automatically.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed

Gray Ooze.name: Gray Ooze

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Corrosive Form.name: Corrosive Form
Corrosive Form.description:
Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed immediately after hitting the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and dealing any damage. Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative −1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and coming into contact with it. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches −5. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} spell on the weapon.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal or wood in 1 round.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Attack Penalty active effect that will modify a targeted weapon. Since this penalty can be applied multiple times to multiple nonmagical weapons, this active effect needs to be dragged from this item's Effect tab onto the target Item's weapons.

Damaged: -1 Attack.name: Damaged: -1 Attack
Damaged: -1 Attack.description: Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative −1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the attacking creature and coming into contact with it.

Pseudopod.name: Pseudopod
Pseudopod.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} spell on the armor.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an AC Penalty enchantment that will modify a targeted armor. Since this penalty can be applied multiple times, this enchantment needs to be dragged from this item's Effect tab onto the target armor item.

Damaged: -1 AC.name: Damaged: -1 AC
Damaged: -1 AC.description: Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} spell on the armor.

Gray Slaad.description:
Slaadi

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Chaos Claw]] attacks.

Chaos Claw.name: Chaos Claw
Chaos Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, &Reference[Charmed apply=false]; on a 2, &Reference[Frightened apply=false]; on a 3, &Reference[Poisoned apply=false]; or on a 4, &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCloudkill0]{Cloudkill}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Cloudkill.name: Cloudkill
Cloudkill.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of yellow-green fog centered on a point within range. The fog lasts for the duration or until strong wind (such as the one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it, ending the spell. Its area is Heavily Obscured.

Each creature in the Sphere makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 5d8 Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this save when the Sphere moves into its space and when it enters the Sphere or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

The Sphere moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=EU2q25V5hIaM1ZlR]], or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Green Dragon Wyrmling.name: Green Dragon Wyrmling
Green Dragon Wyrmling.description:
Green Dragons

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.HxHIj9RZWeGNXKxV caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Green Dragon Wyrmling

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] attacks.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=lnabW9bM51HoluPp]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=lnabW9bM51HoluPp]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=lnabW9bM51HoluPp]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Coven Magic.name: Coven Magic
Coven Magic.description: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.int.dc]]): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAugury0000]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFindFamili]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIdentify00]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLocateObje]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplUnseenServ]{Unseen Servant}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Augury.name: Augury
Augury.description:
You receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses the omen from the Omens table.

OmenFor Results That Will Be …
WealGood
WoeBad
Weal and woeGood and bad
IndifferenceNeither good nor bad

The spell doesn’t account for circumstances, such as other spells, that might change the results.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

Find Familiar.name: Find Familiar
Find Familiar.description:
You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: Bat, Cat, Frog, Hawk, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Rat, Raven, Spider, Weasel, or another Beast that has a Challenge Rating of 0. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form (see appendix B), though it is a Celestial, Fey, or Fiend (your choice) instead of a Beast. Your familiar acts independently of you, but it obeys your commands.

Telepathic Connection. While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as a Bonus Action, you can see through the familiar’s eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the touch. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must take a Reaction to deliver the touch when you cast the spell.

Combat. The familiar is an ally to you and your allies. It rolls its own Initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can’t attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

Disappearance of the Familiar. When the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points, it disappears. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As a Magic action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As a Magic action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

One Familiar Only. You can’t have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new eligible form.

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description:
You touch an object throughout the spell’s casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires Attunement, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell’s name.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn’t know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target’s …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

Unseen Servant.name: Unseen Servant
Unseen Servant.description:
This spell creates an Invisible, mindless, shapeless, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 Hit Point, and a Strength of 2, and it can’t attack. If it drops to 0 Hit Points, the spell ends.

Once on each of your turns as a Bonus Action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring drinks. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.

If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

Mimicry.name: Mimicry
Mimicry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful [[/check format=long]].

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +4 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} (24-hour duration), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only, and the hag leaves no tracks while Invisible), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRayofSickn]{Ray of Sickness} (level 3 version)

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell’s range.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Ray of Sickness.name: Ray of Sickness
Ray of Sickness.description:
You shoot a greenish ray at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 Poison damage and has the &Reference[poisoned] condition until the end of your next turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Green Slaad.name: Green Slaad
Green Slaad.description:
Slaadi

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.AXXqca9xNbd6xnJ6 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Green Slaad

Until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, &Reference[Charmed apply=false]; on a 2, &Reference[Frightened apply=false]; on a 3, &Reference[Poisoned apply=false]; or on a 4, &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]], +6 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}

Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=EU2q25V5hIaM1ZlR]], or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Abduct.name: Abduct
Abduct.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] needn’t spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Beak]] attack and one [[/item Paralyzing Tentacles]] attack.

Paralyzing Tentacles.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
Paralyzing Tentacles.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=MEc8vUTPipCkqjyq]] [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=MEc8vUTPipCkqjyq]], it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from two of ten tentacles. The target is also subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.formula activity=MEc8vUTPipCkqjyq]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically, While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed
Poisoned & Paralyzed.description: The target is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] and can repeat its save at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Celestial Restoration.name: Celestial Restoration
Celestial Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it returns to life in [[/r 1d6#Days]] days and regains all its Hit Points unless @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil] is cast on its remains.

Poisonous Spittle.name: Poisonous Spittle
Poisonous Spittle.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=r4plP8QiJxzFZZO7]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=r4plP8QiJxzFZZO7]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=r4plP8QiJxzFZZO7]] feet.

Failure: 31 (7d8) Poison damage, and the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature ’s next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplClairvoyan]{Clairvoyance}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCureWounds]{Cure Wounds} (level 6 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlameStrik]{Flame Strike} (level 6 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGeas000000]{Geas}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTrueSeeing]{True Seeing}

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Clairvoyance.name: Clairvoyance
Clairvoyance.description:
You create an Invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The intangible, invulnerable sensor remains in place for the duration.

When you cast the spell, choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As a Bonus Action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

A creature that sees the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from See Invisibility or &Reference[truesight]) sees a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
你触碰的一名生物恢复等同于 2d8 + 你施法属性调整值点生命值。

升环施法： 使用的法术位每比一环高一环，治疗量就增加 2d8点。

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Geas.name: Geas
Geas.description:
You give a verbal command to a creature that you can see within range, ordering it to carry out some service or refrain from an action or a course of activity as you decide. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target automatically succeeds if it can’t understand your command.

While Charmed, the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell ends this spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you use a level 7 or 8 spell slot, the duration is 365 days. If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

Under Orders.name: Under Orders
Under Orders.description: While &Reference[Charmed apply=false], the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psyhic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

True Seeing.name: True Seeing
True Seeing.description: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has Truesight with a range of 120 feet.

Gulthias Blight.description:

Blight Seeds.name: Blight Seeds
Blight Seeds.description:
When it finishes a Long Rest, the blight expels [[/r 1d6#Seeds expelled]] seeds into unoccupied spaces on the ground within 30 feet of itself. After 24 hours, the seeds become creatures under the blight’s control. Roll 1d8 for each seed to determine the creature it becomes:

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmBlightSeedCrea rollable classes="caption-top"]

Life-Draining Root.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=3wTX71UEAiIZ5cr4]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=3wTX71UEAiIZ5cr4]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=3wTX71UEAiIZ5cr4]] [[lookup @range.units activity=3wTX71UEAiIZ5cr4]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=3wTX71UEAiIZ5cr4]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of six roots. Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and takes [[/damage average activity=y8c5uBc58T7dKgQf]] damage at the start of each of its turns. The target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Target: Grappled & Restrained.name: Target: Grappled & Restrained
Target: Grappled & Restrained.description:
The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition.

Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition.

Draconic Origin.name: Draconic Origin
Draconic Origin.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is related to a type of dragon associated with one of the following damage types (DM’s choice): Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. This choice affects other aspects of the stat block.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect to manage Damage Resistances in the character sheet's Effects tab. The resistances outlined will need to be manually enabled/disabled.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage of the type chosen for the Draconic Origin trait.

Success: Half damage.

Leap.name: Leap
Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] jumps up to [[lookup @range.value activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]] feet by [[lookup @activation.condition activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]].

Luring Song.name: Luring Song
Luring Song.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sings a magical melody, which lasts until the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Concentration ends on it.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]], each [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] when the song starts.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the song ends and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns. While Charmed, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and ignores the Luring Song of other harpies.

If the target is more than 5 feet from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the target moves on its turn toward the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. It doesn’t avoid &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]; however, before moving into damaging terrain (such as lava or a pit) and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the target repeats the save.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Luring Song for 24 hours.

Charmed & Incapacitated.name: Charmed & Incapacitated
Charmed & Incapacitated.description:
The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the song ends and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns.

While Charmed, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

If it revives, it animates another Gargantuan object or structure elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

Charisma Saving Throw: DC 17, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target is teleported inside the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space and swallowed. A swallowed [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]] has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Hit Points, a swallowed [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]] can leave the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the Plane Shift spell.

Aura of Authority.name: Aura of Authority
Aura of Authority.description: While in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dE4lg9tZyXtoCb5x]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its allies have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws, provided the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .zhAbcimNBve1uH40]] or [[/item .NUHMt2G5DVatjbOM]] in any combination.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Expend Use.name: Expend Use
Expend Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Hobgoblin Warrior.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmHalfPlateA]{Half Plate Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepLongbow000]{Longbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepLongsword0]{Longsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmShield0000]{Shield}

Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition.

Telepathic Bond.name: Telepathic Bond
Telepathic Bond.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is on the same plane of existence as its master, the two of them can communicate telepathically with each other.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. Hit: [[/damage]] damage, and the target is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=zINRP55nQzeLTh4x]].

Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of the homunculus’s next turn.

Failure by 5 or More: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute. While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition, which ends early if the target takes any damage.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the biter's next turn. While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition, which ends early if the target takes any damage.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition, which ends early if the target takes any damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmHook0000000000]] attacks.

Hook.name: Hook
Hook.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves the target 5 feet straight toward or away from itself.

attack.chatFlavor: On Hit: Target pulled 5 ft toward or away

Diabolical Restoration.name: Diabolical Restoration
Diabolical Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmSearingFork000]] or [[/item .mmHurlFlame00000]] in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmInfernalTail00]].

Hurl Flame.name: Hurl Flame
Hurl Flame.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a flammable object that isn’t being worn or carried, it starts burning.

Infernal Tail.name: Infernal Tail
Infernal Tail.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=tJYeyUk3iPYJq9xM]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=tJYeyUk3iPYJq9xM]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=tJYeyUk3iPYJq9xM]] [[lookup @range.units activity=tJYeyUk3iPYJq9xM]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=tJYeyUk3iPYJq9xM]] damage, and the target receives an infernal wound if it doesn’t have one. While wounded, the target loses [[/damage average activity=zZfCQ0IeJZCjPLzE]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after [[lookup @duration.value activity=tJYeyUk3iPYJq9xM]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=tJYeyUk3iPYJq9xM]], after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a [[/check dc=17 ability=wis skill=med format=long]].

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] ([[lookup @activation.condition activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]]), reach [[lookup @range.value activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]] [[lookup @range.units activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]]. [[/damage average extended]].

attack.condition: with Advantage if the target doesn’t have all its Hit Points

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hold its breath for 1 hour.

Multiple Heads.name: Multiple Heads
Multiple Heads.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has five heads. Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 25 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns when it has at least one living head, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken Fire damage since its last turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 20 Hit Points when it grows new heads.

Reactive Heads.name: Reactive Heads
Reactive Heads.description: For each head the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has beyond one, it gets an extra &Reference[Reaction] that can be used only for &Reference[OpportunityAttacks].

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes as many [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks as it has heads.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition.

Diabolical Restoration.name: Diabolical Restoration
Diabolical Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmIceSpear000000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a [[/item .mmTail0000000000]] attack.

Ice Wall.name: Ice Wall
Ice Wall.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWallofIce0]{Wall of Ice} (level 8 version), requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.int.dc]]).

Wall of Ice.name: Wall of Ice
Wall of Ice.description:
You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a globe with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature’s space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (you choose which side) and makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10d6 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has AC 12 and 30 Hit Points per 10-foot section, and it has Immunity to Cold, Poison, and Psychic damage and Vulnerability to Fire damage. Reducing a 10-foot section of wall to 0 Hit Points destroys it and leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied.

A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 5d6 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage the wall deals when it appears increases by 2d6 and the damage from passing through the sheet of frigid air increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 6.

Frigid Air.name: Frigid Air
Frigid Air.condition: creature moves through the wall for the first time on a turn

Ice Spear.name: Ice Spear
Ice Spear.description:
[[/attack extended]].

Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. Until the end of its next turn, the target can’t take a &Reference[Bonus Action] or &Reference[Reaction], its Speed decreases by 10 feet, and it can move or take one action on its turn, not both.

Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Speed -10.name: Speed -10
Speed -10.description: Until the end of its next turn, the target's speed decreases by 10 feet.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] explodes [[lookup @activation.condition activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]].

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Frost Breath.name: Frost Breath
Frost Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=ChLJgxjftTSMSRHe]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=ChLJgxjftTSMSRHe]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=ChLJgxjftTSMSRHe]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description: The mephit casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFogCloud00], requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

pH1Rf3FfwlD3EELa.name: Fog Cloud
pH1Rf3FfwlD3EELa.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog’s radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

BGYUyh36nOQKX4Pr.name: Invisibility
BGYUyh36nOQKX4Pr.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts to resemble a rat (Speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., Fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., Climb 20 ft.), or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Succubus Form.name: Succubus Form
Succubus Form.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] finishes a Long Rest, it can shape-shift into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmSuccubus000000]{Succubus}, using that stat block instead of this one. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Restless Touch.name: Restless Touch
Restless Touch.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target is cursed for 24 hours or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies. Until the curse ends, the target gains no benefit from finishing Short Rests.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: The target is cursed for 24 hours or until the attacking creature dies. Until the curse ends, the target gains no benefit from finishing Short Rests.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRestlessTouch0]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDream00000]{Dream}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHypnoticPa]{Hypnotic Pattern}

Nightmare.name: Nightmare
Nightmare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Y9H9ImnMcffBZlH3]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Y9H9ImnMcffBZlH3]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Y9H9ImnMcffBZlH3]] feet.

Failure: If the target has 20 Hit Points or fewer, it has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for [[lookup @duration.value activity=Y9H9ImnMcffBZlH3]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=Y9H9ImnMcffBZlH3]], until it takes damage, or until a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it. Otherwise, the target takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: If the target has 20 Hit Points or fewer, it has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for 1 hour, until it takes damage, or until a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can’t see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane can’t perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn’t border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description:
You target a creature you know on the same plane of existence. You or a willing creature you touch enters a trance state to act as a dream messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target’s dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the spell’s duration. The messenger can also shape the dream’s environment, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking.

If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to sleep, at which point the messenger enters its dreams.

You can make the messenger terrifying to the target. If you do so, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words, and then the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and it takes 3d6 Psychic damage when it wakes up.

Trance State.name: Trance State
Trance State.description: While in the trance, the messenger is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed, the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Hypnotized.name: Hypnotized
Hypnotized.description:
While &Reference[charmed apply=false], the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Claw]] attack and uses [[/item Devour Intellect]].

Detect Intelligence.name: Detect Intelligence
Detect Intelligence.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically senses the location of any creature within 300 feet of itself that has an Intelligence score of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers.

Devour Intellect.name: Devour Intellect
Devour Intellect.description:
Intelligence Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7LNepwMsw4xbXyRk]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=7LNepwMsw4xbXyRk]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=7LNepwMsw4xbXyRk]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Steal Body.name: Steal Body
Steal Body.description:
Intelligence Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=dKA6FqhkPRD5rLhA]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=dKA6FqhkPRD5rLhA]]

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] possesses the target, consumes its brain, and teleports inside its skull.

While there, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; its understanding of Deep Speech; its telepathy; and its Detect Intelligence trait. It otherwise adopts the target’s game statistics. It knows everything the target knew, including spells and languages.

If the host body dies, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must leave it. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is also forced out if the target regains its devoured brain by means of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell.

By spending 5 feet of its movement, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can voluntarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The body then dies unless its brain is restored before the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Total Cover.name: Total Cover
Total Cover.description: The possessesing creature has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects originating outside its host.

Languages.name: Languages
Languages.description: The possessing creature retains its understanding of Deep Speech and its telepathy.

Air Form.name: Air Form
Air Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can enter an enemy’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmWindSwipe00000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmVortex00000000]].

Vortex.name: Vortex
Vortex.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=cZy0VYbCVY8aRB4z]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=cZy0VYbCVY8aRB4z]] in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=cZy0VYbCVY8aRB4z]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target can’t cast spells with a Verbal component and takes [[/damage average activity=kDz92inkRCjGrPiz]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s turns.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description:
The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC).

Until the grapple ends, the target can’t cast spells with a Verbal component and takes additional damage at the start of each of the NPC’s turns.

Fire Absorption.name: Fire Absorption
Fire Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Fire damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Fire damage dealt.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attack, using [[/item Bladed Arm]] or [[/item Fiery Bolt]] in any combination.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=lnabW9bM51HoluPp]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=lnabW9bM51HoluPp]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=lnabW9bM51HoluPp]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRend0000000000]]{Rend} or [[/item .mmSlam0000000000]]{Slam} attacks.

Sleep Gaze.name: Sleep Gaze
Sleep Gaze.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] feet (Constructs and Undead succeed automatically).

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for [[lookup @labels.duration activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] or until it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Sleep Gaze for 24 hours.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for the duration (see source item for the length of the duration) or until it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Medium human or a Medium jackal-humanoid hybrid, or it returns to its true form (that of a Small jackal). Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Living Shadow.name: Living Shadow
Living Shadow.description:
While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Resistance to damage that isn’t Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect to manage Damage Resistances in the character sheet's Effects tab. The resistances outlined will need to be manually enabled/disabled.

Acid Resistance.name: Acid Resistance
Acid Resistance.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the creature has Resistance to damage that isn’t Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

Bludgeoning Resistance.name: Bludgeoning Resistance
Bludgeoning Resistance.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the creature has Resistance to damage that isn’t Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

Cold Resistance.name: Cold Resistance
Cold Resistance.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the creature has Resistance to damage that isn’t Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

Fire Resistance.name: Fire Resistance
Fire Resistance.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the creature has Resistance to damage that isn’t Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

Lightning Resistance.name: Lightning Resistance
Lightning Resistance.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the creature has Resistance to damage that isn’t Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

Necrotic Resistance.name: Necrotic Resistance

The shadow is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s control and shares the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Initiative count but acts immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Mimicry.name: Mimicry
Mimicry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful [[/check format=long]].

Shadow Blade.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. Hit or Miss: The blade magically returns to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Eldritch Lantern.name: Eldritch Lantern
Eldritch Lantern.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.int.dc]]).

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Hold Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

Tentacle.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of ten tentacles, and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Fling.name: Fling
Fling.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] throws a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=E7YKnUIWsavrnNzK]] Grappled by it to a space it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=E7YKnUIWsavrnNzK]] feet of itself [[lookup @range.special activity=E7YKnUIWsavrnNzK]].

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=E7YKnUIWsavrnNzK]], the creature thrown and each creature in the destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Lightning Strike.name: Lightning Strike
Lightning Strike.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=v39JwGqgfaKiA4vc]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=v39JwGqgfaKiA4vc]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=v39JwGqgfaKiA4vc]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]] Grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (it can have up to four creatures swallowed at a time).

Failure: [[/damage average activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]] damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is swallowed and no longer Grappled. A swallowed creature has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and takes [[/damage average activity=zrWNjO9mkbN28spL]] damage at the start of each of its turns.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=rGeGukkm2t2fXsoy]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting Prone.

Restrained & Total Cover.name: Restrained & Total Cover
Restrained & Total Cover.description: While swallowed, a creature has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, has &Reference[Total Cover apply=false] against attacks.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If you are regurgitated, you fall into a space within 10 ft. and are &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Escape: Prone.name: Escape: Prone
Escape: Prone.description: Any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Toxic Ink.name: Toxic Ink
Toxic Ink.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Kquf9zADg0jtKBqw]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Kquf9zADg0jtKBqw]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Kquf9zADg0jtKBqw]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while it is underwater.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] conditions until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] then moves up to its Speed.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Blinded & Poisoned.name: Blinded & Poisoned
Blinded & Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] conditions until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Sticky Shield.name: Sticky Shield
Sticky Shield.description:
Trigger: A creature misses the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with a melee attack roll using a weapon. Response—Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=A8a55LxaAvNmIUnj]], the triggering creature.

Failure: The attack’s weapon sticks to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s shield. If the target doesn’t let go of the weapon, the target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition while the weapon is stuck (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). While stuck, the weapon can’t be used. The target can take an action to make a [[/check ath dc=@skills.ath.passive format=long]], freeing the weapon on a success.

Save.name: Save
Save.condition: A creature misses the kuo-toa with a melee attack roll using a weapon.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target doesn’t let go of the weapon, the target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition while the weapon is stuck (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC)

Sticky Net.name: Sticky Net
Sticky Net.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.formula activity=MxEs7KnCVGemObHx]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=MxEs7KnCVGemObHx]] [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=MxEs7KnCVGemObHx]] the kuo-toa can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=MxEs7KnCVGemObHx]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the net is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage). A creature can take an action to make a [[/skill ath 10]] check to free itself or another creature in a net within 5 feet, destroying the net on a success.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the net is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage). A creature can make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check to free itself or another creature in a net within 5 feet, destroying the net on a success.
