Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Smoke Mephit.name: Smoke Mephit
Smoke Mephit.description:
Mephits

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.C5AnYUB2Vhu0urqS caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Smoke Mephit

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.NwAge4RajZjmo4gX caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] explodes [[lookup @activation.condition activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]].

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Cinder Breath.name: Cinder Breath
Cinder Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=tb7VfYTYKzOxuE5S]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=tb7VfYTYKzOxuE5S]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the user's next turn.

Divine Awareness.name: Divine Awareness
Divine Awareness.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows if it hears a lie.

Exalted Restoration.name: Exalted Restoration
Exalted Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside Mount Celestia, its body disappears, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Mount Celestia.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Flying Sword]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Slaying Bow]].

Slaying Bow.name: Slaying Bow
Slaying Bow.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=C7BMf8hIfCjxRSWC]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=C7BMf8hIfCjxRSWC]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=C7BMf8hIfCjxRSWC]] [[lookup @range.units activity=C7BMf8hIfCjxRSWC]].

Failure: If the [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=C7BMf8hIfCjxRSWC]] has 100 Hit Points or fewer, it dies. It otherwise takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Flying Sword.name: Flying Sword
Flying Sword.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Hit or Miss: The sword magically returns to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s hand or hovers within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] immediately after a ranged attack.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommune000]{Commune}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplControlWea]{Control Weather}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplResurrecti]{Resurrection}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Commune.name: Commune
Commune.description:
You contact a deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren’t necessarily omniscient, so you might receive “unclear” as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity’s knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity’s interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

Control Weather.name: Control Weather
Control Weather.description:
You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, and it ends early if you go indoors.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes 1d4 × 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.

When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can change its direction.

Precipitation
StageCondition
1Clear
2Light clouds
3Overcast or ground fog
4Rain, hail, or snow
5Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard
Temperature
StageCondition
1Heat wave
2Hot
3Warm
4Cool
5Cold
6Freezing
Wind
StageCondition
1Calm
2Moderate wind
3Strong wind
4Gale
5Storm

Dispel Evil and Good.name: Dispel Evil and Good
Dispel Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.

Break Enchantment. As a Magic action, you touch a creature that is possessed by or has the &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Frightened] condition from one or more creatures of the types above. The target is no longer possessed, Charmed, or Frightened by such creatures.

Dismissal. As a Magic action, you target one creature you can see within 5 feet of you that has one of the creature types above. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be sent back to its home plane if it isn’t there already. If they aren’t on their home plane, Undead are sent to the Shadowfell, and Fey are sent to the Feywild.

Dispelling Evil and Good.name: Dispelling Evil and Good
Dispelling Evil and Good.description: For the duration, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions: Break Enchantment or Dismissal.

Resurrection.name: Resurrection
Resurrection.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century, didn’t die of old age, and wasn’t Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with all its Hit Points. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death. This spell closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Casting this spell to revive a creature that has been dead for 365 days or longer taxes you. Until you finish a Long Rest, you can’t cast spells again, and you have Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 1)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 2)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 3)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 4)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Spell Taxed.name: Spell Taxed
Spell Taxed.description: Until you finish a Long Rest, you can’t cast spells again, and you have Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Blinding Gaze.name: Blinding Gaze
Blinding Gaze.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=B6xM8C2pABIb5o7y]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=B6xM8C2pABIb5o7y]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition for 1 minute.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Radiant Teleport.name: Radiant Teleport
Radiant Teleport.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports up to [[lookup @range.value activity=HtsFBK1PYKjvy9mn]] feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=HtsFBK1PYKjvy9mn]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=HtsFBK1PYKjvy9mn]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] at its destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCureWounds]{Cure Wounds} (level 2 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
你触碰的一名生物恢复等同于 2d8 + 你施法属性调整值点生命值。

升环施法： 使用的法术位每比一环高一环，治疗量就增加 2d8点。

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner’s Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Eye Rays]] twice.

Eye Rays.name: Eye Rays
Eye Rays.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll [[/r 1d4]]; reroll if the beholder has already used that ray during this turn):

Eye Rays

1: Confusion Ray.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=tXwLl6S6OFtqJeTm]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=tXwLl6S6OFtqJeTm]] damage, and the target can’t take Reactions until the end of its next turn. On its next turn, the target can’t move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can’t attack, it does nothing on that turn.

2: Paralyzing Ray.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=EZ5rsyCFKBY3TWww]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=EZ5rsyCFKBY3TWww]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=EZ5rsyCFKBY3TWww]], it succeeds automatically.

3: Fear Ray.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=aMfevxGsYy5swVDA]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=aMfevxGsYy5swVDA]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

4: Wounding Ray.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12.

Failure: 16 (3d10) Necrotic damage.

Success: Half damage.

Confused/No Reactions.name: Confused/No Reactions
Confused/No Reactions.description: The target can't take Reactions until the end of its next turn. On its next turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on that turn.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Paralyzing Ray: Paralyzed.name: Paralyzing Ray: Paralyzed
Paralyzing Ray: Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Spell Reflection.name: Spell Reflection
Spell Reflection.description:
Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=ZYmB6aUHCqkMh0Ji]]

Response—Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=ZYmB6aUHCqkMh0Ji]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=ZYmB6aUHCqkMh0Ji]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=ZYmB6aUHCqkMh0Ji]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Save.name: Save
Save.condition: succeeds on a saving throw against a spell, or a spell’s attack roll misses it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Sphinx of Lore.name: Sphinx of Lore
Sphinx of Lore.description:
Sphinxes

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.JPdmXY7WGZdIPlJo caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Sphinx of Lore

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.fKMxrzT2eWlAqDAn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Inscrutable.name: Inscrutable
Inscrutable.description: No magic can observe the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with Disadvantage.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Mind-Rending Roar.name: Mind-Rending Roar
Mind-Rending Roar.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=zPMfwwIoTFzIrN5H]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=zPMfwwIoTFzIrN5H]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=zPMfwwIoTFzIrN5H]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIdentify00]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLegendLore]{Legend Lore}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLocateObje]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description:
You touch an object throughout the spell’s casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires Attunement, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell’s name.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Legend Lore.name: Legend Lore
Legend Lore.description:
Name or describe a famous person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about that famous thing, as described by the DM.

The lore might consist of important details, amusing revelations, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. The more information you already know about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is. That information is accurate but might be couched in figurative language or poetry, as determined by the DM.

If the famous thing you chose isn’t actually famous, you hear sad musical notes played on a trombone, and the spell fails.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner’s Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Arcane Prowl.name: Arcane Prowl
Arcane Prowl.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can teleport up to [[lookup @range.value activity=a3RqyzU0UqzLJif0]] feet to an unoccupied space it can see, and it makes one [[/item Claw]] attack.

Weight of Years.name: Weight of Years
Weight of Years.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]] feet.

Failure: The target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level. While the target has any Exhaustion levels, it appears [[/r 3d10]] years older.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Sphinx of Secrets.name: Sphinx of Secrets
Sphinx of Secrets.description:
Sphinxes

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.JPdmXY7WGZdIPlJo caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Sphinx of Secrets

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.OhcZTXr50rKAYzoj caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Inscrutable.name: Inscrutable
Inscrutable.description: No magic can observe the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with Disadvantage.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Claw]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Curse of the Riddle]].

Curse of the Riddle.name: Curse of the Riddle
Curse of the Riddle.description:
Intelligence Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=RbCvwBYpqZFD3jac]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=RbCvwBYpqZFD3jac]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=RbCvwBYpqZFD3jac]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is cursed with a riddle. The cursed target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. In addition, if it takes the Magic action, it must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or that action is wasted.

The cursed target can take a &Reference[Study] action to make a [[/check dc=15 ability=int format=long]], solving the riddle and ending the curse on a success. The curse ends early if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] curses another target.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: The target is cursed with a riddle. The cursed target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIdentify00]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLocateObje]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description:
You touch an object throughout the spell’s casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires Attunement, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell’s name.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner’s Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Sphinx of Valor.name: Sphinx of Valor
Sphinx of Valor.description:
Sphinxes

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.JPdmXY7WGZdIPlJo caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Sphinx of Valor

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.lb8l0oAUq5gHE7SE caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Inscrutable.name: Inscrutable
Inscrutable.description: No magic can observe the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with Disadvantage.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks and uses [[/item Roar]].

Roar.name: Roar
Roar.description:
The sphinx emits a magical roar. Whenever it roars, the roar has a different effect, as detailed below (the sequence resets when it takes a Long Rest):

First Roar.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]], each enemy in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition for [[lookup @duration.value activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]].

Second Roar.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=uFTndQPvULZVHT9R]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=uFTndQPvULZVHT9R]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=uFTndQPvULZVHT9R]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=uFTndQPvULZVHT9R]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=uFTndQPvULZVHT9R]], it succeeds automatically.

Third Roar.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Td8ArIMDfxWDLbE9]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Td8ArIMDfxWDLbE9]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Td8ArIMDfxWDLbE9]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=Td8ArIMDfxWDLbE9]] damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition for 1 minute.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHeroesFeas]{Heroes’ Feast}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplZoneofTrut]{Zone of Truth}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target’s Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target’s Hit Point maximum

Heroes' Feast.name: Heroes' Feast
Heroes' Feast.description:
You conjure a feast that appears on a surface in an unoccupied 10-foot Cube next to you. The feast takes 1 hour to consume and disappears at the end of that time, and the beneficial effects don’t set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve creatures can partake of the feast.

A creature that partakes gains several benefits, which last for 24 hours. The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

Consume Feast.name: Consume Feast
Consume Feast.chatFlavor: Hit Point maximum increased by healing amount

Feast's Benefits.name: Feast's Benefits
Feast's Benefits.description: The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

Zone of Truth.name: Zone of Truth
Zone of Truth.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Cannot Lie.name: Cannot Lie
Cannot Lie.description:
On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Arcane Prowl.name: Arcane Prowl
Arcane Prowl.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can teleport up to [[lookup @range.value activity=a3RqyzU0UqzLJif0]] feet to an unoccupied space it can see, and it makes one [[/item Claw]] attack.

Weight of Years.name: Weight of Years
Weight of Years.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]] feet.

Failure: The target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level. While the target has any Exhaustion levels, it appears [[/r 3d10]] years older.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Sphinx of Wonder.name: Sphinx of Wonder
Sphinx of Wonder.description:
Sphinxes

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.JPdmXY7WGZdIPlJo caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Sphinx of Wonder

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.knvt7pCk5slbRRf0 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Burst of Ingenuity.name: Burst of Ingenuity
Burst of Ingenuity.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name]] or another creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=AyYipNx3cFaXA0LU]] feet makes an ability check or a saving throw. Response: The sphinx adds 2 to the roll.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t provoke an &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]{Opportunity Attack} when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmInfernalFork00]] and [[/item .mmTailSpine00000]] in any combination.

Fiendish Restoration.name: Fiendish Restoration
Fiendish Restoration.description: If it dies, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] returns to life in [[/r 1d6]] days and regains all its Hit Points. Only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] or [[/item .mmNecroticRay000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWaterBreat]{Water Breathing}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDimensionD]{Dimension Door}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person} (level 3), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (level 4)

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Water Breathing.name: Water Breathing
Water Breathing.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport to a location within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as “200 feet straight downward” or “300 feet upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle.”

You can also teleport one willing creature. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you teleport, and it teleports to a space within 5 feet of your destination space.

If you, the other creature, or both would arrive in a space occupied by a creature or completely filled by one or more objects, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 Force damage, and the teleportation fails.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Enchanting Bow.name: Enchanting Bow
Enchanting Bow.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Heart Sight.name: Heart Sight
Heart Sight.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=NqVrZShDV1L3zBA3]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=NqVrZShDV1L3zBA3]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=NqVrZShDV1L3zBA3]] feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see (Celestials, Fiends, and Undead automatically fail the save).

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the target’s emotions and alignment.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

FAek73jM5CyQOO60.name: Invisibility
FAek73jM5CyQOO60.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Spy.name: Spy
Spy.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepHandCrossb]{Hand Crossbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepShortsword]{Shortsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbtulThievesToo]{Thieves' Tools}

Spies

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VCqqHnYYkh2Hn5w6 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Spy

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.O5k5Yo9UowcBfqiB caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Spy Master.name: Spy Master
Spy Master.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepHandCrossb]{Hand Crossbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepRapier0000]{Rapier}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbtulThievesToo]{Thieves' Tools}

Spies

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VCqqHnYYkh2Hn5w6 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Spy Master

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.vbqXzTJoaTzXe1mz caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .fGAdNyRwPx2l059M]] or [[/item .BDLqabSxdqDm0MC2]] in any combination.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Slow.name: Slow

rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.name: Slow
rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot Cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target’s Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can’t take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs<=25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell’s gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Foundry Note

The inline roll above will return 1 if it succeeded or 0 if it failed.

Slowed.name: Slowed
Slowed.description:
An affected target’s Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can’t take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell’s gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplControlWea]{Control Weather}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Control Weather.name: Control Weather
Control Weather.description:
You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, and it ends early if you go indoors.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes 1d4 × 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.

When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can change its direction.

Precipitation
StageCondition
1Clear
2Light clouds
3Overcast or ground fog
4Rain, hail, or snow
5Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard
Temperature
StageCondition
1Heat wave
2Hot
3Warm
4Cool
5Cold
6Freezing
Wind
StageCondition
1Calm
2Moderate wind
3Strong wind
4Gale
5Storm

Incubus Form.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] finishes a Long Rest, it can shape-shift into an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmIncubus0000000]{Incubus}, using that stat block instead of this one.

Draining Kiss.description:

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Medium or Small Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except its Fly Speed is available only in its true form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as “Attack that creature,” “Move over there,” or “Fetch that object.” The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn’t receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafened & Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Deafened apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions until the end of its next turn.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (it can have up to six creatures swallowed at a time).

Failure: The target is swallowed, and the Grappled condition ends. A swallowed creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions and can’t teleport, it has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and takes [[/damage average activity=zrWNjO9mkbN28spL]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=rGeGukkm2t2fXsoy]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within [[lookup @range.value activity=rGeGukkm2t2fXsoy]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting Prone.

Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.name: Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover
Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.description: While swallowed, a creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, has &Reference[Total Cover apply=false] against attacks.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If you are regurgitated, you fall into a space within 10 ft. and are &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Onslaught.name: Onslaught
Onslaught.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] or [[/item .mmTail0000000000]] attack.

World-Shaking Movement.name: World-Shaking Movement
World-Shaking Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed. At the end of this movement, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] creates an instantaneous shock wave in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=g4W0ovZxBeUrZKb8]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=g4W0ovZxBeUrZKb8]]. Emanation originating from itself. Creatures in that area lose &Reference[Concentration] and, if Medium or smaller, have the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: Creatures in that area lose &Reference[Concentration] and, if Medium or smaller, have the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] deals double damage to objects and structures.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spelldc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand} (the hand is Invisible)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSending000]{Sending}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSynapticSt]{Synaptic Static}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Sending.name: Sending
Sending.description:
You send a short message of 25 words or fewer to a creature you have met or a creature described to you by someone who has met it. The target hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables targets to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn’t arrive. You know if the delivery fails.

Upon receiving your message, a creature can block your ability to reach it again with this spell for 8 hours. If you try to send another message during that time, you learn that you are blocked, and the spell fails.

Synaptic Static.name: Synaptic Static
Synaptic Static.description:
You cause psychic energy to erupt at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes an Intelligence saving throw, taking 8d6 Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

On a failed save, a target also has muddled thoughts for 1 minute. During that time, it subtracts [[/r 1d6]] from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as any Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration. The target makes an [[/save ability=int dc=@attributes.spelldc format=long]] at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Muddled Thoughts.name: Muddled Thoughts
Muddled Thoughts.description: The target subtracts 1d6 from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as any Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration. The target makes an [[/save ability=int format=long]] at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Rend.name: Rend
Rend.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Nimble Escape.name: Nimble Escape
Nimble Escape.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Disengage] or &Reference[Hide] action.

Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepHeavyCross]{Heavy Crossbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepMace000000]{Mace}

Grasping Root.name: Grasping Root
Grasping Root.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]] [[lookup @range.units activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]].

Until the grapple ends, the target takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of its turns.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmGore0000000000]] attacks.

Gore.name: Gore
Gore.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]]. If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=iBenqFiBu40bUxkH]] creature and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra [[/damage 2d8 average type=piercing]] damage and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition if the attacking creature used its moving attack feature.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]], any creature (other than a [[lookup @name lowercase]]) that starts its turn in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Loathsome Limbs.name: Loathsome Limbs
Loathsome Limbs.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends any turn Bloodied and took 15+ Slashing damage during that turn, one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]l’s limbs is severed, falls into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space, and becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmTrollLimb00000]{Troll Limb}. The limb acts immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb, and it grows replacement limbs the next time it regains Hit Points.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect condition in the character sheet's Effects tab to enable each level of Exhaustion. Since the condition can be applied multiple times, the GM must manually manage the level of Exhaustion. There is an active effect available for each level of exhaustion.

Exhaustion 1.name: Exhaustion 1
Exhaustion 1.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 2.name: Exhaustion 2
Exhaustion 2.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 3.name: Exhaustion 3
Exhaustion 3.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 4.name: Exhaustion 4
Exhaustion 4.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 5.name: Exhaustion 5
Exhaustion 5.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion Dead.name: Exhaustion Dead
Exhaustion Dead.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Charge.name: Charge
Charge.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to [[lookup @range.special activity=Y2IncZu5BjB42z7l]] straight toward an enemy it can see.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

Troll Spawn.name: Troll Spawn
Troll Spawn.description: The limb uncannily has the same senses as a whole [[lookup @name lowercase]]. If the limb isn’t destroyed within 24 hours, roll [[/r 1d12#On a 12, the limb turns into a troll]]{roll 1d12}. On a 12, the limb turns into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmTroll000000000]{Troll}. Otherwise, the limb withers away.
